0.title: India enter first-ever Thomas Cup final, beats Denmark 3-2
0.article_body: Indian men's badminton team has created history by reaching the Thomas Cup final for the first time after defeating Denmark 3-2 in semi-final on Friday. While Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty, Kidambi Srikanth and HS Prannoy won their respective matches, Lakshya Sen and Krishna Prasad Garaga-Vishnuvardhan Goud Panjala lost. India will face Indonesia in the final on Sunday.

1.title: Kerala is rapidly becoming 'Talibanised': State BJP President
1.article_body: Kerala BJP President K Surendran criticised the state government, saying Kerala is rapidly becoming "Talibanised". Surendran's comment came days after a Muslim cleric opposed a class 10 girl's presence on the stage at a felicitation ceremony in Malappuram. "Kerala is moving towards the ideology followed by Taliban with the help and knowledge of the Chief Minister," Surendran said.

2.title: Japan to offer $100 mn to Indo-Pacific nations to fight COVID-19
2.article_body: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi on Friday announced that Japan plans to offer $100 million in aid to developing countries in the Indo-Pacific region in their fight against the coronavirus pandemic. The funds will help in vaccination data management, border control and disposal of infectious waste, he said. Hayashi made the comments on sidelines of a G7 Foreign Ministers meeting.

3.title: Lucknow Police ban e-rickshaws on 11 routes in city
3.article_body: Lucknow Police said that e-rickshaws have been banned on 11 routes in the city to improve the traffic system. These routes include Shaheed Path, Hazratganj market and metro routes from Amausi to Munshi Pulia crossing, the police added. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic), Subhash Chandra Shakya, said that e-rickshaws have been causing inconvenience to commuters.

4.title: RCB is playing like proper unit in IPL 2022: Dasgupta
4.article_body: Commenting on RCB's form in ongoing IPL, Deep Dasgupta said they are playing like a proper unit. "In their last game (against SRH), they delivered their best performance of this season. For example, Rajat Patidar has been contributing in almost every match, which has been the hallmark of the team," he added. RCB are currently fourth on points table.

5.title: More Indians die in road accidents than in war: Union Minister
5.article_body: Addressing an event organised by ASSOCHAM, Union Minister General (Retd) VK Singh said that more Indians die in road accidents than in a war. He said road safety is the most important issue that the government needs to tackle. "We have road safety week. We upgraded it to road safety month," he said, adding it should be a 365-day affair.

6.title: Bihar-based cyber fraudsters who cheated people of ₹1 cr arrested
6.article_body: The Cyber Police busted a Bihar-based gang that cheated people of up to ₹1 crore and arrested three persons, along with equipment and documents used by them, the police said. They added that the gang cheated people on the pretext of providing them benefits of various government schemes through fake websites. The police said they managed to recover ₹8.39 lakh.

7.title: Biden considering visit to DMZ during trip to S Korea: White House
7.article_body: The White House Press Secretary on Thursday said that US President Joe Biden is considering a trip to the Korean Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) when he visits Asia later this month. Biden is expected to visit South Korea and Japan from May 20-24. The White House was still finalising details of the Asia schedule, the secretary added.

8.title: IFS officer spots leopard outside rest house, says 'spent time in each other's company'
8.article_body: IFS officer Akash Deep Badhawan shared a picture of a leopard outside his rest house. "Like a Ruskin Bond story, met this one outside a Forest Rest House...we spent a good amount of time in each other's company last night," he tweeted. "So much wildlife history in the walls of these 120 plus years old FRH of Katarniaghat," he added.

9.title: Kohli looks towards sky & speaks to himself after getting out for 20, video goes viral
9.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli looked towards the sky and spoke to himself after getting out for 20(14) against PBKS. Kohli was caught out at short fine leg after the ball brushed his glove and lobbed off his thigh pad. "Hope luck turns on your side soon!" PBKS tweeted. A user tweeted, "Kohli literally begging for some luck."

10.title: MP may consider national anthem recital mandate in madrasas: Minister
10.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday said the state government may consider making the recital of the national anthem mandatory in all madrasas in the state. Mishra's statement comes a day after the Uttar Pradesh government issued an order mandating recital of the national anthem in all madrasas. Mishra added that the national anthem can be sung everywhere.

11.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of forcibly deporting over 2 lakh children
11.article_body: Russia has forcibly deported more than 2.1 lakh children since the start of its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Ukraine's ombudsman for human rights Lyudmyla Denisova said on Friday. Ukraine has also accused Russia of wanting to make the deported children Russian citizens. Denisova claimed that the children are among the 12 lakh people forcibly deported by Russia.

12.title: Children fall as water slide breaks at amusement park in Indonesia, video surfaces
12.article_body: A video has shown children falling around 10 feet to the ground after a water slide broke in half during their ride at an amusement park in Indonesia. The incident took place recently in Kenjeran park in East Java. The video shows water rushing out as the slide structure collapses. Around 16 children were injured in the incident.

13.title: Beach house worth ₹3cr collapses into the ocean in US as sea levels rise, pic surfaces
13.article_body: A beach house worth $3,81,200 (nearly ₹3 crore) in North Carolina's Outer Banks recently collapsed. It was unoccupied at the time, officials said, adding the area has been closed off for time being. The collapse is part of what officials worry could be a growing issue amid severe weather this week as well as long-term concerns like rising sea levels.

14.title: It's a reflection of them, not me or my wife: Ranveer on trolling
14.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, on being asked about trolling received by him and his wife Deepika Padukone, stated that it's just a reflection of them and not him or his wife. "When that criticism comes, it's so absolutely baseless that I don't even subscribe to the idea that it should be put forth, let alone be affected by it," Ranveer added.

15.title: Guv must reject it: Siddaramaiah on K'taka anti-conversion bill
15.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP over the anti-conversion bill and urged the Governor to reject it. He said the BJP was trying to 'force' anti-conversion law on the people through an ordinance route to 'divert their attention' from issues like corruption and lack of administration. He alleged that the bill will be used to "threaten and harass minorities".

16.title: Meghalaya woman tied to pole, heckled by onlookers for pickpocketing
16.article_body: A woman was tied to a pole at a marketplace in Meghalaya's Jowai and heckled by onlookers for alleged pickpocketing, police said. A video of the incident surfaced on social media, in which she was purportedly seen being taken to a shed by unknown persons. "All the people seen in the video will be called for questioning," an officer said.

17.title: Iraqi-born man injures 5 people in knife attack on train in Germany
17.article_body: An Iraqi-born man injured five people during a knife attack on a train in Germany on Friday, authorities said. The 31-year-old attacker was overpowered by an off-duty police officer and two other passengers. Notably, the man had been investigated for possible Islamic extremism while living in a refugee hostel in 2017, a top law enforcement official said.

18.title: 16 killed in fire at building near Delhi's Mundka metro station
18.article_body: At least 16 bodies have been recovered so far from the building that caught on fire near the Mundka metro station on Friday, Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said. Around 10 people have been injured and more are trapped inside the three-storey commercial building, Delhi Police said. The third floor is yet to be searched, Garg said.

19.title: Over 350 Kashmiri Pandit govt employees submit mass resignation letter to J&K L-G
19.article_body: Over 350 Kashmiri Pandit employees under the Prime Minister's employment package have submitted a mass resignation letter to J&K Lieutenant Governor (L-G) Manoj Sinha. In the letter, they reportedly told L-G and Centre that they didn't feel safe in Kashmir. This comes after Kashmiri Pandit government employee Rahul Bhat was shot dead by terrorists in tehsildar office in Budgam.

20.title: SRH's Malik can play for any team if he brings control with pace: McGrath
20.article_body: Talking about Umran Malik's performance in IPL 2022, ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said if the SRH pacer can combine control with his sheer pace then he'll get into any team in the world. The 22-year-old from Jammu and Kashmir has clocked 150 kmph consistently in the ongoing IPL. Malik has so far taken 15 wickets in 11 matches for SRH.

21.title: PM Narendra Modi is a man of ideas: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
21.article_body: Speaking at the launch of a technical training programme for rural tribals in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan called PM Narendra Modi a "man of ideas". "Fortunately, this country has a visionary prime minister. He has not only visions, but also ideas to execute them on the ground," he said.

22.title: I'm not injured, I'm living with an injury: Nadal on his foot pain
22.article_body: Ten-time champion Rafael Nadal said he was suffering with a lot of foot pain in his third-round loss against 13th seed Denis Shapovalov at 2022 Italian Open.  "No, I'm not injured. I'm a player living with an injury. That's it. No, no, is nothing new," he added. Nadal had ended his 2021 season early due to a left foot injury.

23.title: Congress party's 'chintan shivir' is 'chinta shivir': MP minister
23.article_body: BJP leader and Madhya Pradesh's Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday said the Congress party's 'chintan shivir' is 'chinta shivir' to save their party. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during the three-day 'chintan shivir'. Surjewala stated inflation, unemployment and increasing debt as reasons for holding the session.

24.title: Govt is hiding its failures by spreading hatred: Mehbooba Mufti
24.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti accused the Central government of "spreading hatred between Hindus and Muslims just to hide its failures". "It is presenting the two communities as enemies of each other," she said. Speaking after the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat, Mufti urged Muslims of the valley to help and support the minorities living there.

25.title: South Korea plans to provide COVID-19 vaccine to North Korea
25.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol's office on Friday announced that South Korea plans to provide COVID-19 vaccines and other medical supplies to North Korea. "We will discuss detailed plans for assistance with North Korea," the President's office said. The announcement comes a day after North Korea confirmed its first coronavirus outbreak.

26.title: G7 strongly united in supporting Ukraine until victory, says France
26.article_body: French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian on Friday said that G7 countries are "very strongly united" in their will to continue to provide support to Ukraine in its fight against Russia until a Ukrainian victory. "It's very important...that we keep up the pressure on Vladimir Putin by supplying more weapons to Ukraine," British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

27.title: Congress wants to make itself stronger: Kharge at 'Chintan Shivir'
27.article_body: Addressing party workers in Udaipur at Congress' 'Chintan Shivir', Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said that the party wants to make itself stronger. Speaking about an alliance with other parties, he said, "We want to take all parties on board but it can only happen if they have similar ideologies, belief in the social fabric and democratic values."

28.title: Things are finally working for me after 20 years: Manav Kaul
28.article_body: Actor Manav Kaul has stated that after 20 years of his career, things are "finally" working for him. The actor further said that OTT platforms are not just about the actors but about creative people, DOPs, directors and other technical crew. "What makes me happier is that there are so many women writers...stories about women and...women-led projects," Manav added.

29.title: More Indians anaemic than before, 67% kids under 5 affected: NFHS
29.article_body: An increasing number of people across all population groups in India, including children, adolescent girls and boys and pregnant women, is being affected by anaemia, according to the National Family Health Survey-5 (NFHS). According to the survey report, at least 67% children below the age of five years have anaemia, compared to 58.6% in the last survey conducted in 2015-16.

30.title: Unlike Hindi film industry, South industry has got its math right: Richa Chadha
30.article_body: Richa Chadha has said South industry has got its math right in terms of numbers and ticket prices. "Unlike...Hindi film industry and its greedy film distributors, there they keep...ticket at ₹100-400 even if it's a hit...Over here, due to...ticket priced above ₹400, footfall will decrease," she stated. "Audience will pay for food and beverage. Naturally, cinema will suffer," said Richa.

31.title: RCB's Josh Hazlewood records worst bowling figures of IPL 2022
31.article_body: RCB fast bowler Josh Hazlewood on Friday recorded the worst bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 31-year-old Australian conceded 64 runs without taking a wicket against PBKS. Hazlewood, whose figures read 4-0-64-0, was hit for seven fours and four sixes in his spell. The previous worst bowling figures of IPL 2022 were 4-0-63-0 recorded by SRH fast bowler Marco Jansen.

32.title: Man cheats 100 women of lakhs by posing as MBA graduate on matrimonial site
32.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who has studied till class 12, cheated over 100 women of lakhs of rupees by posing as an engineering and MBA graduate on a matrimonial site, police said. Farhan Khan was arrested after a female AIIMS doctor, who was cheated of ₹15 lakh, filed a complaint in Delhi. One BMW car was seized from his possession.

33.title: MVA govt must introspect: BJP MP on Patole's 'backstabber' remark
33.article_body: BJP MP Gopal Shetty criticised Congress' Nana Patole for his 'backstabbing' remark, saying all three parties of MVA- Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP should 'introspect and quit the government'. He said, "All three parties...have backstabbed the BJP and Devendra Fadnavis." His comment came after Patole called NCP 'backstabber' as it joined hands with BJP during the Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

34.title: Malayalam cinema ahead of others in terms of content: Mammootty
34.article_body: Actor Mammootty has stated that Malayalam cinema is ahead of other industries in terms of content, adding that the Hindi film industry pays a lot of attention to Malayalam cinema. The actor further said that OTT platforms brought the silent audience into the cinema fold which was earlier unable to go to theatres due to the lack of time.

35.title: Hyderabad Police chief holds meet with pub & restaurant owners
35.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand conducted a meeting with pub and restaurant owners to 'reiterate the government's stand against drug abuse'. This meeting comes after drugs were found on the premises of Pudding and Mink pub, the police said. In the meeting, the Commissioner also raised the issue of complaints by citizens regarding sound pollution, parking congestion, etc.

36.title: 11 including 10 students injured as truck hits school bus in Haryana
36.article_body: At least 10 students and a bus conductor sustained injuries after a truck allegedly hit a private school bus carrying at least 25 students in Haryana's Sonipat on Friday. "Preliminary probe has found that the truck driver was speeding and he rammed into the bus from the side. The windowpanes of the bus shattered upon impact," a police officer said.

37.title: India declares 1-day state mourning tomorrow after UAE President's demise
37.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Friday announced that one-day state mourning will be observed in India on Saturday as a mark of respect on the passing away of UAE President and Abu Dhabi ruler Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan. The National Flag will be flown at half-mast on all the buildings where the Tricolour is flown regularly tomorrow.

38.title: Growing up, I wanted to play and behave like him: Shapovalov on Nadal
38.article_body: Following his third round win over Rafael Nadal at 2022 Italian Open, 13th seed Denis Shapovalov said he's a huge fan of the 10-time champion. "Growing up, I wanted to play and behave like him." He added, "I definitely super-look up to him." Shapovalov beat Nadal 1-6, 7-5, 6-2 on Thursday. It was the Canadian's second win against the Spaniard.

39.title: If I were a selector, I'd pick Karthik for India's T20 WC squad: Harbhajan
39.article_body: Praising Dinesh Karthik, Harbhajan Singh said the RCB wicketkeeper-batter has been outstanding and he's the best finisher in ongoing IPL. "If I were a selector I would've given him a ticket to Australia for World Cup T20 and let him play for India as wicketkeeper and batsman," he added. Karthik has scored 274 runs in 12 matches so far.

40.title: Bengaluru temperature currently cooler than many hill stations, Twitter users react
40.article_body: Bengaluru on Wednesday recorded a maximum temperature of 24.3°C, the lowest in May in the last 10 years, according to IMD. As per Twitter users, Bengaluru was cooler than many hill stations in India, with many users posting screenshots of weather apps. "Packing bags already!" a user tweeted while another wrote, "Bangalore giving hill stations a run for their money."

41.title: 'SpiceJet charging extra for boarding pass,' says woman; Scindia replies 'will examine'
41.article_body: A woman took to Twitter to complain about SpiceJet, stating that the airline is charging extra if a passenger wishes to get a boarding pass at check-in counter. After a journalist called the rule "ridiculous" and tagged Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, the minister replied, saying, "Agreed, will examine this asap!" More airlines are reportedly charging passengers for boarding passes.

42.title: Turkey not supportive of Finland & Sweden joining NATO: Prez
42.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Friday said that NATO-member Turkey does not support plans by Sweden and Finland to join the military alliance. Erdoğan also claimed that the Nordic countries were home to many "terrorist organisations". Notably, Turkey has criticised Sweden and Western European countries for their handling of organisations deemed terrorists by the Turkish government.

43.title: 30 policemen hurt as Maha villagers clash over Shivaji statue, 300 booked
43.article_body: Over 30 police personnel received minor injuries after two groups of villagers clashed in Maharashtra's Jalna district. The clashes took place over the installation and removal of a statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and naming of a newly-constructed gate in the village after late BJP leader Gopinath Munde. According to police, over 300 people have been booked for violence.

44.title: Pic showing Zakir Hussain as Pt Shivkumar's pallbearer at his funeral surfaces
44.article_body: A picture showing renowned tabla artist Zakir Hussain shouldering the remains of santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma has been widely shared online. Sharma was cremated with full state honours in Mumbai on Wednesday. Hussain and Sharma were reportedly friends and collaborators for decades. "Never seen a more poignant photograph," said a Twitter user while reacting to Hussain's picture.

45.title: Blockchain behind collapsed UST, LUNA tokens resumes activity after 9-hour halt
45.article_body: The blockchain behind stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, and its affiliated LUNA token has resumed activity after a nine-hour halt on Friday. The Terra blockchain had stopped processing new transactions for the second time in less than a day after UST and LUNA collapsed. Several crypto exchanges, including WazirX, CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber, delisted LUNA from their platforms on Friday.

46.title: PBKS record the highest powerplay score of IPL 2022
46.article_body: PBKS today recorded the highest powerplay score of IPL 2022 by scoring 83/1 in their first six overs against RCB. The previous highest powerplay score of IPL 2022 had come on April 20, when DC scored 81/0 against PBKS. PBKS opener Jonny Bairstow scored 59*(22), including seven sixes, in the first six overs today.

47.title: 4 on way to wedding die, 2 hurt as vehicle falls into gorge in Shimla
47.article_body: Four persons, including three women, were killed and two others sustained injuries when their vehicle fell into a 100-metre gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla district, police said. The incident took place when the victims were on their way to attend a wedding. "Primarily, negligent and rash driving caused the accident," Shimla Superintendent of Police Monika Bhutungru said.

48.title: Rock paintings said to be 10,000-30,000 yrs old found in T'gana, pics surface
48.article_body: A Mesolithic age rock art site has been discovered at Kasipeta in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district in Telangana. It was found on a small hillock on private land and is believed to be between 10,000 and 30,000 years old, reports said. The paintings reportedly feature four bisons, two men and an animal bearing a resemblance to a horse.

49.title: Population not sole criteria for delimitation in J&K: CEC Chandra
49.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra on Friday said that population was not the sole criteria while carrying out delimitation exercise in J&K. He mentioned that "physical conditions, and communication facilities, public conveniences and the administrative units" were also considered. Of the 90 assembly constituencies, Jammu region will have 43 seats and Kashmir region will have 47 seats.

50.title: 'Calling a man bald at work is sexual harassment,' rules UK tribunal
50.article_body: An England employment tribunal has ruled that calling a man "bald" in workplace falls within the purview of sexual harassment. It stated that baldness was more prevalent in men than women, adding, "In our judgment, there's a connection between the word 'bald'...and the protected characteristic of sex." The case pertained to a man being called "bald c**t" by his supervisor.

51.title: J&K govt forms SIT to probe Rahul Bhat's killing, to give govt job to his wife
51.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir government has constituted a Special Investigation Team to investigate the murder of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists on Thursday. The administration will provide a government job to Bhat's wife and financial assistance to his family, J&K LG Manoj Sinha's office said. The government will also bear the educational expenses of his daughter.

52.title: Out-of-control Tesla car crashes into building at 112 km/hr in US, CCTV footage surfaces
52.article_body: CCTV footage showing a Tesla car crashing into the Greater Columbus Convention Center in Ohio, in the US, has surfaced online. The clip shared by Now This News on Twitter shows the vehicle hitting a curb and ramming into the building at the speed of 112 km/hr. The crash caused an estimated damage of more than $250,000.

53.title: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
53.article_body: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.

54.title: Try to learn a new shot every year: PBKS' Jitesh on his form in IPL 2022
54.article_body: Speaking on the secret of his success in his debut IPL season, PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma stated he tries to learn a new shot every year or learn something new. Jitesh has scored 162 runs in nine matches at a strike rate of over 160 in ongoing IPL. "I didn't expect that I would've a season like this," he added.

55.title: 3 J&K govt employees terminated over alleged terror links: Report
55.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) administration has terminated three state government employees, including a professor and a police constable, for their alleged links with terror groups, according to a report. Their termination was based on the recommendation of a designated committee in J&K, the report said. Reportedly, one of the terminated employees had crossed over to Pakistan for terror training.

56.title: Ranveer hosts 'Jayeshbhai...' screening for underprivileged kids
56.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh hosted a screening of his film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for underprivileged children in Mumbai on Friday. Pictures show the actor cutting cake at the screening and dancing with the children. He said, "I will also choose important films like Jayeshbhai Jordaar that satirically talks about patriarchy and toxic masculinity...It is a film that had to be made."

57.title: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery initiative being re-evaluated: Report
57.article_body: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery service is being re-evaluated as the company was unable to meet time targets for all orders during its Gurugram pilot, Economic Times reported. Shortage of delivery fleet and intense heat wave are causing delivery delays of 15-20 minutes, the report stated. It further said that Zomato has halted plans to initiate 10-minute delivery services in Bengaluru.

58.title: Bus with Vaishno Devi pilgrims catches fire due to overheated tank in J&K, 4 killed
58.article_body: At least four people were killed and around 20 others were injured on Friday when a bus carrying pilgrims to Vaishno Devi caught on fire near Katra in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. The fire was caused by an explosion in the bus tank due to overheating caused by the weather, Reasi Deputy Commissioner Babila Rakwal said.

59.title: People carrying reporter Shireen's coffin clash with Israeli police; video surfaces
59.article_body:
Israeli police clashed with Palestinian mourners carrying Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh's coffin at the start of her funeral procession in Jerusalem on Friday. A video showed the group carrying her coffin almost dropping the casket and saving it just before one end hit the ground. She 
was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank.

60.title: Dhaakad has 14-min fight sequence, longest in Hindi films: Kangana
60.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said that the film has an approximately 14-minute long fight sequence, adding that it is the longest such sequence in Hindi cinema. The actress further said that the Indian film industry should be scared of the American film industry and should come together to save Indian screens from international films.

61.title: Rupinder ruled out of Asia Cup due to wrist injury, Lakra to lead India
61.article_body: Drag-flicker Rupinder Pal Singh has been ruled out of the Asia Cup Hockey, starting from May 23 in Jakarta, due to a wrist injury. Rupinder, who was named captain of the 20-member squad, sustained the injury during a training session. Defender Birendra Lakra will replace Rupinder as captain, while forward SV Sunil will step in as the vice-captain.

62.title: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
62.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".

63.title: BJP chief JP Nadda holds roadshow in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
63.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda and CM Jairam Thakur held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh on Friday. Addressing a gathering, Nadda said, "Under the guidance of PM Narendra Modi and CM Jairam Thakur, the people of Himachal Pradesh are eager to give their blessings to BJP again." Notably, Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh are likely to be held later this year.

64.title: Major fire in building near Delhi metro station, 24 tenders reach spot
64.article_body: A major fire broke out in a building near pillar number 544 at Delhi's Mundka metro station on Friday. As many as 24 fire tenders were rushed to the spot after Delhi Fire Services received information. "Cranes are being used to go up and douse the fire. There's no information on the rescue operation yet," DFS Chief Atul Garg said.

65.title: RCB to bowl first against PBKS, playing XIs announced
65.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. RCB are fielding an unchanged side, while Harpreet Brar has replaced Sandeep Sharma in PBKS' playing XI. RCB are currently fourth on the points table with 14 points, while PBKS are on the eighth position with 10 points.

66.title: Will bulldoze if MCD doesn't act: AAP on encroachment at BJP leader's home
66.article_body: Senior AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Friday claimed that the municipal corporations in the city were not taking any action against the alleged encroachments by BJP leaders and officials. "The AAP will bulldoze the unauthorised construction at [Delhi BJP chief] Adesh Gupta's residence and office...if the MCD fails to act against it by 11 am on Saturday," Pathak said.

67.title: He was a great statesman: PM Modi condoles demise of UAE's Prez
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday condoled the demise of United Arab Emirates' President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan. "He was a great statesman and visionary leader under whom India-UAE relations prospered," PM Modi said. "The heartfelt condolences of the people of India are with the people of UAE. May his soul rest in peace," the PM added.

68.title: Indian Embassy to resume operation in Kyiv amid Russia-Ukraine war
68.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday announced that the Indian Embassy in Ukraine, which was temporarily operating out of Poland, would be resuming its operation in Ukrainian capital of Kyiv from May 17. The operation was shifted amid shelling in the city after Russia announced invasion of Ukraine in February.

69.title: Heartless section still calling tragedy of Kashmir a lie: Anupam
69.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video message on Friday, saying that "a section of heartless people" is still calling 'The Kashmir Files' a lie. He added that the film was a "tight slap" on the faces of those calling this "tragedy" a lie for over 32 years. Anupam also spoke about Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat who was shot dead recently.

70.title: My $2.8 mn is literally worth $1,000: YouTuber KSI after losing millions in LUNA crash
70.article_body: YouTuber KSI claimed he lost about $2.8 million after the cryptocurrency LUNA crashed. He revealed he had put $2.8 million in LUNA, but it plummeted to a new valuation of less than $1,000 in a day. Speaking about how previous losses made him depressed and seek therapy, KSI wrote about the recent loss, "But that's ok because I'm not dead."

71.title: Hindi speakers sell pani puris in Tamil Nadu: State minister amid language row
71.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over the national language, Tamil Nadu Higher Education Minister K Ponmudy has said that Hindi speakers "sell pani puris" in Coimbatore. "We were told that learning Hindi would land us jobs. Did we get jobs?" said Ponmudy. This came after Home Minister Amit Shah said that people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English.

72.title: England's bold Test coach appointment of McCullum makes me nervous: Vaughan
72.article_body: After Brendon McCullum was named as head coach of England's Test team, Michael Vaughan said, "England's appointment of McCullum makes me nervous." He added, "He's taking over England at the right time. They are at their lowest ebb since the mid-1990s." Vaughan further said, "He will not have to do much for us all to see a massive improvement."

73.title: India to send delegations to 9 countries to discuss wheat exports
73.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that it'll send trade delegations to Morocco, Tunisia, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Turkey, Algeria and Lebanon to explore possibilities of boosting wheat exports from India. India has set a target of a record 10 million tonnes of wheat export in 2022-23, it added. This comes amid a rising demand for wheat due to Russia-Ukraine war.

74.title: 61.5 kg gold worth ₹32.5 crore seized at Delhi's Air Cargo Complex
74.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 61.5 kilograms of gold concealed in triangle valves imported at the Air Cargo Complex in Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The seized gold has a market value of ₹32.5 crore and was found to be of 99% purity, the Finance Ministry said. The consignment had reportedly originated from China's Guangzhou.

75.title: Symbiosis to reinstate unvaccinated staffer who was asked to go on leave
75.article_body: Pune-based Symbiosis Society has told the Bombay High Court that it'll reinstate one of its unvaccinated employees who was asked to go on unpaid leave till he produced a vaccine certificate. We'll review the COVID-19 vaccination mandate for employees, it added. Subrata Mazumdar, who didn't get vaccinated amid health issues, had moved court after being asked to go on leave.

76.title: 260-yr-old gold coach to be part of UK Queen's 4-day Platinum Jubilee celebration
76.article_body: The British Royal Family has announced that the 260-year-old Gold State Coach will be part of Queen Elizabeth II's Platinum Jubilee celebration. "The...Coach transported The Queen to her Coronation 75 years ago, and hasn't been...on the streets of London for over 20 years," the Royal Family said. The celebration will see a four-day public holiday from June 2 in UK.

77.title: We identified Rohit as a possible captain for MI during IPL 2011: Pollock
77.article_body: Recalling how MI had already identified Rohit Sharma as a future captain of the franchise after he impressed with his form during IPL 2011, Shaun Pollock said the 35-year-old was very mature beyond his years in many ways. "He's been fantastic for the Mumbai franchise as Dhoni has been for CSK," he added. Rohit-led MI have won five titles.

78.title: Still committed to acquisition: Musk after putting $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
78.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted he's "still committed to acquisition" after he put on hold the $44 billion deal to take Twitter private. Musk has temporarily put the deal on hold while he awaits data supporting Twitter's claim that spam accounts comprise less than 5% of users. Twitter shares fell to their lowest level since Musk disclosed his stake after the announcement.

79.title: Govt raises ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC priced at ₹949
79.article_body: The government has raised ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) has been priced at the top of the range at ₹949. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake, was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding. LIC is likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17.

80.title: Vicky Kaushal was chillest groom, his aim was to party: Stylist
80.article_body: Amandeep Kaur, who was Vicky Kaushal's stylist for his wedding with Katrina Kaif, has called him the "chillest groom of all time", adding that his aim was to party and have a good time. "Vicky...on his wedding day...was truly happy...He was just so excited. I was just surprised at how beautifully, gracefully he went through the entire event," Amandeep added.

81.title: Tu hero ban jayega: Kartik Aaryan on advice to younger self
81.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actors Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani were asked in an interview about what advice they would give to their younger selves. Kiara said, "I'd just say that it's all going to work out." Kartik added, "I'd frame it for both of us, 'Don't worry...Tu hero aur tu heroine ban jayegi' (You'll become hero and you'll become heroine)."

82.title: They've got to playoff hopes without Kohli's support: Vaughan on RCB
82.article_body: Discussing RCB's playoff possibilities in IPL 2022, Michael Vaughan said they have performed well so far in IPL 2022 despite Virat Kohli's significant contribution. "He averages under 20...if he can find form, with the likes of Faf du Plessis, Glenn Maxwell and co., this is such a dangerous team," he added. RCB are currently fourth on the points table.

83.title: 2 rowdy sheeters, 8 accomplices held for plotting robbery in B'luru
83.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested two rowdy sheeters and their eight accomplices, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Friday. All 10 were arrested for plotting a robbery in the city, Gupta said. Police have seized lethal weapons and two cars from the accused's possession.

84.title: Plants grown in Moon soil for the first time, NASA shares pics
84.article_body: In a first, plants have successfully been grown in soil collected from the Moon's surface during the Apollo era, NASA said on Thursday while sharing pictures. Researchers at the University of Florida planted thale cress in lunar soil that was brought back by astronauts decades ago. The plants, however, grew slower, showed signs of stress and were also stunted.

85.title: Always listen to your wife: Pune Police chief tells Twitter user
85.article_body: Pune City Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta recently took to Twitter to answer citizens' questions about various law and order issues. When a user on the micro-blogging site told Gupta that he was in a dilemma about where he should relocate, the police chief said, "Always listen to your wife." "Everyone including me does the same," Gupta added.

86.title: Police bust gambling club in Delhi's Sadar Bazar, arrest 17 people
86.article_body: Delhi Police have busted a gambling club in the Sadar Bazar area and arrested 17 people who were indulging in the offence, DCP (North) Sagar Singh Kalsi said. According to police, they carried out a raid at a house after receiving a tip-off and subsequently found a gambling den being operated there. Police have recovered ₹26,620 cash from their possession.

87.title: 'Doorway' spotted on Mars in new image released by NASA
87.article_body: A newly released image by NASA, taken by Curiosity Rover, appears to show a "doorway" cut into the rock face on Mars. One social media user described the scene as "a formation on Mars which appears to be a portal and a wall nearby that looks artificial." There has been no official explanation from the American space agency about it.

88.title: Cong has given us a lot and it's time to pay it back: Sonia Gandhi
88.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi, while speaking at the party's Chintan Shivir in Udaipur, said changes in the organisation are the "need of the hour". "We need to change the way we work," she added. "We've to keep the organisation above personal ambitions as the party has given us a lot and it's time to pay it back," Gandhi further said.

89.title: They love it there: Sanjay Dutt on his family shifting to Dubai
89.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, talking about why his family chose to settle down in Dubai in 2020, said it wasn't a planned move. "It...happened on its own. Maanayata was doing...business in Dubai, it clicked and she went...and...kids went with her," he added. Sanjay said his 11-year-old twins Shahraan and Iqra "love it there", adding that they like their school and their activities.

90.title: Umran bowled at 157 kmph, he has something no one else has: Ian Bishop
90.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik has something "no one" else in the world has, having bowled at a speed of 157 kmph in IPL 2022. "I think if he gets into the India squad, he may not have to play immediately," added Bishop. Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra stated that Umran is not ready to play for India.

91.title: Definitely at no. 6 or 7 in T20 WC: Gavaskar on Dinesh Karthik
91.article_body: Former India skipper Sunil Gavaskar has backed RCB batter Dinesh Karthik to play the role of a "finisher" for India in this year's ICC T20 World Cup. "The way the IPL is going for him at the moment...I would definitely look at him as a batter who can come in at no. 6 or no. 7," Gavaskar said.

92.title: Hyderabad Police seize 250 grams of marijuana, peddler arrested
92.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a drug peddler and seized 250 grams of marijuana and hashish oil weighing 1,062 grams from him. The police said that they have also seized a two-wheeler from the accused. This comes days after the Cyberabad Police seized 800 kg of marijuana worth ₹2 crore and arrested two people.

93.title: We shot in a coal mine, our lungs were filled with soot: Kangana on Dhaakad
93.article_body: Kangana Ranaut recalled shooting action sequences for her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad', and said, "We shot in a coal mine and our lungs were filled with soot." "It was coming out of our nostrils," she added. "We shot internationally as well as locally in India. We shot in Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh. Our director shot in the harshest terrains," Kangana said.

94.title: He was shocked as it was clearly not out: Kaif on Rohit's dismissal vs KKR
94.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MI captain Rohit Sharma was "shocked" following his dismissal for 2 in MI's loss against KKR. "Rohit was clearly not out," added Kaif. Kaif stated that Rohit's "poor form" having scored 218 runs in IPL 2022 so far is a "huge" talking point, adding it could prove "costly" for India in T20 World Cup 2022.

95.title: PBKS can win only if Mayank doesn't bat or scores a fifty: Chopra
95.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has made a prediction on the match between the Punjab Kings and the Royal Challengers Bangalore. "It won't be a bad idea (for PBKS) to bat first," Chopra said. "PBKS can only win if either Mayank Agarwal's batting doesn't come or...he scores a fifty. Otherwise, RCB are favourites to win this match," he added.

96.title: Nadal knocked out of Italian Open by 23-year-old Denis Shapovalov
96.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was knocked out of the Italian Open after losing his 'Round of 16' match to Canada's Denis Shapovalov by 6-1, 5-7 and 2-6 on Thursday. The 16th-ranked Shapovalov handed the fourth-ranked Nadal his earliest tournament exit since 2008. "I am not injured. I am a player living with an injury," Nadal said.

97.title: Cigarette butt collection drive in B'luru to bolster public smoking rules
97.article_body: A cigarette and beedi butt collection campaign has been launched in Bengaluru to highlight the rampant smoking in public places. The campaign will culminate on May 31, when all the collected cigarettes' and beedis' butts will be displayed. Under the campaign, an MoU will also be submitted to get the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) amendment bill passed.

98.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.2 hits Arunachal Pradesh’s Changlang
98.article_body: An earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Richter Scale hit South Changlang in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to National Center for Seismology (NCS). The quake struck at 12:39 pm, at a depth of 120 kilometres, the NCS said on Twitter. Earlier in the morning, NCS had tweeted that an earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hit Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala at 7:46 am.

99.title: Transgenders to get dedicated OPD at Pune's Sassoon hospital
99.article_body: Pune's Sassoon General Hospital will form an exclusive Out Patient Department (OPD) for transgenders, according to a letter from the hospital to NCP MP Vandana Chavan. "The transgender community faces several health issues. Due to financial constraints, most of them visit Sassoon hospital," Chavan said. "But, when they are at the OPD, they are being stared at," she added.

100.title: ISRO successfully carries out static test of Gaganyaan rocket's booster
100.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation on Friday successfully completed the static test firing of solid fuel-powered rocket booster engine for its human space mission programme Gaganyaan. This booster engine is part of Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle Mark III (GSLV Mk III) rocket that will carry Indian astronauts to space. The test was conducted at Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota,  ISRO tweeted.

101.title: Cash, silver worth ₹3.7 lakh stolen from a house in Navi Mumbai
101.article_body: Thieves broke into a house in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai and stole cash and silver biscuits worth a total of ₹3.7 lakh, the police said. They broke into the house on May 4, when the complainant had gone out of town, police added. He returned on May 8 and immediately complained to the police about the robbery.

102.title: Travis Scott sued by woman for miscarriage due to Astroworld tragedy
102.article_body: Rapper Travis Scott has been sued by a woman who claims she suffered miscarriage after being "trampled and crushed" at the Astroworld concert. According to Entertainment Tonight, Shanazia Williamson stated she suffered "horrific injuries" at the 2021 music festival in Houston. Notably, ten people died and hundreds were injured following a stampede during Scott's performance at the concert.

103.title: TN SC/ST commission seeks response over ban on beef, pork at biryani fest
103.article_body: The Tamil Nadu State Commission for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes has sought an explanation from the District Collector Tirupathur over the ban on beef and pork from the Ambur Biryani festival. The commission had called the move in the food festival, which was organised by the district administration, discriminatory against the SC, ST and the Muslim community.

104.title: TikTok sued by family of 10-yr-old US girl who died in viral challenge
104.article_body: The family of a 10-year-old US girl who choked herself to death allegedly while participating in TikTok's viral 'blackout challenge', has sued the platform. Nylah Anderson was found unconscious in her bedroom in December 2021. She spent five days in an ICU before succumbing to her injuries. Her family alleges TikTok's algorithm pushed the dare in front of her.

105.title: Want to see more acceptance for women behind camera: Lara Dutta
105.article_body: Lara Dutta said the industry has become accustomed to seeing women taking up more challenging roles behind the camera. "I want to see more acceptance [of that]," she said while taking examples of Alia, Deepika and Kangana who have their own production houses. "I want to see more women succeed within...business...because that's when you'll...see change in content," the actress added.

106.title: Can't pick Hardik in T20 WC squad for bowling 140 kmph in 2 games: Parthiv
106.article_body: Discussing all-rounder Hardik Pandya's potential selection in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India player Parthiv Patel said, "You can't pick a player for bowling at 140 kmph in two matches." "You need to a pick a fully fit player...If he gets injured then what happens? It will be India's loss," added Parthiv.

107.title: Finland sees no direct military threats from Russia: Envoy
107.article_body: Finnish Ambassador to NATO Klaus Korhonen said there are no "direct military threats against Finland" by Russia at present. However, Finland expects potential "cyber harassment" and "disinformation campaigns" by Russia, he added. The comments come after Russia on Thursday warned Finland against joining NATO and threatened it with "retaliatory steps, both of a military-technical and other nature".

108.title: 19-year-old Tilak records most runs by a teenager in an IPL season, breaks Pant's record
108.article_body: MI's 19-year-old batting all-rounder Tilak Varma has set the record for scoring the most runs by a teenager in an IPL season. With his knock of 34*(32) against CSK, Tilak took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 368. The previous record was held by Rishabh Pant, who scored 366 runs in IPL 2017 as a 19-year-old for DC.

109.title: Govt issues norms after cutting precaution dose gap to 3 months for overseas travel
109.article_body: Those travelling overseas can now take the precaution COVID-19 vaccine dose three months (instead of the current nine months) after second dose, the government has said while releasing guidelines. Those travelling abroad for education, jobs, sports events or business etc can avail the facility. They aren't required to upload visas or travel documents on the CoWIN portal for the same.

110.title: NIA charges BSF officer, 10 others over arms supply to terrorists
110.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed a chargesheet against 11 accused, including a BSF officer, in connection with a case of pilferage of arms and ammunition and supplying weapons to a terrorist organisation in Jharkhand. The weapons were allegedly supplied by the accused persons to armed cadres of CPI (Maoist) and terrorist gang of Aman Sahu.

111.title: Parents who confined son with 22 dogs in Pune held, later get bail
111.article_body: The parents of an 11-year-old boy who allegedly confined their son at an apartment in Pune with 22 stray dogs were arrested on Thursday and later released on bail, police said. The couple was granted bail based on Code of Criminal Procedure, police added. "Medical test of the boy was done and he is doing well," a police sub-inspector said.

112.title: Video shows son of Tripura Dy CM misbehaving with MPs in Agartala hotel
112.article_body: A video showing Prateek Dev Varma, the son of Tripura Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma, allegedly misbehaving with a team of parliamentary members, who visited the state, has surfaced on social media. The incident took place at Polo Towers hotel in Agartala on Wednesday. Also, when the hotel officials tried to intervene, reportedly inebriated Prateek shouted invectives at them.

113.title: Tesla puts on hold plans to sell electric cars in India over import duties: Report
113.article_body: Tesla has reportedly put on hold plans to sell electric cars in India after the company failed to secure lower import taxes. Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has abandoned a search for showroom space in the country and reassigned some of its domestic team, Reuters reported citing sources. In 2021, Musk had said that India has the world's highest import duties.

114.title: Felt like a newcomer on set: Sharmila on returning to films after 12 yrs
114.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, who's set to make an acting comeback after a gap of 12 years with the film 'Gulmohar', has said she felt like a newcomer on set. "It was fun to work on a film with no pressure at all...It was liberating, more like a wonderful holiday," she added. 'Gulmohar' also stars Manoj Bajpayee and Suraj Sharma.

115.title: UAE President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan passes away aged 73
115.article_body: United Arab Emirates' President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan has passed away at the age of 73, state news agency WAM reported. Born in 1948, Sheikh Khalifa was the second President of UAE and 16th ruler of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. He is expected to be succeeded by his half-brother Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan.

116.title: Kerala football team to get cash reward of ₹1.14 crore from state govt
116.article_body: Kerala government has announced a cash reward of ₹1.14 crore for the state's football team for winning this year's Santosh Trophy. The decision was taken in a cabinet meeting chaired by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. Notably, ₹5 lakh each will be given to 20 players and the head coach while the rest of the support staff will get ₹3 lakh each.

117.title: Gold worth ₹8.38 crore found hidden in vehicles in Assam, Nagaland
117.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has said that it intercepted two oil tankers and a truck and seized smuggled gold worth ₹8.38 crore from separate points on the National Highway between Assam's Guwahati and Nagaland's Dimapur on Thursday. The gold, smuggled through Indo-Myanmar border, had been concealed in different parts of the vehicles. Five people were arrested in the matter.

118.title: Rubina Dilaik charging ₹10-15 lakh per week for Rohit's 'Khatron...': Reports
118.article_body: Bigg Boss 14 winner and actress Rubina Dilaik is reportedly charging between ₹10 to 15 lakh per week for 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', hosted by Rohit Shetty. According to reports, 'Lock Upp' winner and stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui is charging between ₹3.5 to 4 lakh per week for the stunt-based reality show. Rubina will be the highest-paid contestant, reports stated.

119.title: Heavy traffic on Mumbai-Pune Expressway as truck, trailer collide
119.article_body: Commuters experienced a heavy traffic jam on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway on Friday morning after an accident occurred on the way to Mumbai, according to reports. The accident reportedly took place after a truck and a trailer collided with each other. Following this, a long queue of vehicles stretched for nearly one and a half to two kilometres, the reports added.

120.title: I don't think hybrid work method will work: Airbnb CEO Chesky
120.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that he didn’t believe that the hybrid method, wherein employees come to office two to three days per week, will work. He added that this eventually would lead people coming to office on a different day of the week. Chesky said a better version would be assuming that people will be wherever they work best.

121.title: 21-year-old model-actress Sahana found dead on her birthday in Kerala
121.article_body: A model and actress, Sahana, was found dead on her 21st birthday in Kerala's Kozhikode, with police taking her husband Sajjad into custody after her family alleged that she was murdered. "She used to cry all the time saying they (husband and his family) were torturing her," Sahana's parents said. Sajjad told police he found her dead in bathroom.

122.title: Ex-eBay exec charged with harassing US couple pleads guilty
122.article_body: Former director of global resiliency at eBay, David Harville, has pleaded guilty in the US to five conspiracy and stalking counts, becoming the last of seven ex-workers admitting to harassing a US couple who spoke against eBay. The seven people participated in a campaign against the couple that involved sending them disturbing home deliveries like cockroaches and a funeral wreath.

123.title: 70 kgs of lemons worth over ₹60,000 stolen from market in Ghaziabad
123.article_body: Some unidentified persons allegedly stole more than 70 kilograms of lemons, worth ₹60,000-70,000, from a vegetable market in Ghaziabad district on Wednesday night. According to the police, the thieves arrived on a motorcycle and a mini-truck, loaded 12 sacks of lemons onto the mini-truck and escaped within a few minutes. Police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

124.title: Gurmeet Ram Rahim gets bail in 2 cases linked to sacrilege incident in Punjab
124.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda head Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was on Friday granted bail by the Faridkot court in two cases of sacrilege. Singh has now got bail in all three cases linked to the 2015 sacrilege incident that took place in Bargari in Punjab. He is currently serving sentence in rape and murder cases in a jail in Rohtak, Haryana.

125.title: BJP brutalising minorities, glorifying Gandhiji's killers: Sonia at Cong's 'Chintan Shivir'
125.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, while speaking at Chintan Shivir in Udaipur, said the BJP government was "brutalising minorities and glorifying Mahatma Gandhi's killers". "It has become...clear what PM [Narendra] Modi and his colleagues really meant by their slogan 'maximum governance, minimum government'," she added. "It means keeping the country in a permanent state of polarisation," Gandhi said.

126.title: MP govt delays police physical test due to heat as 2 aspirants die
126.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to postpone the physical fitness test for the police recruitment exam till June 2 due to "scorching" heat, the state Home Minister Narottam Mishra announced on Thursday. This comes after two police aspirants died during the physical tests. Both the deceased candidates had reportedly collapsed after the 800-metre race.

127.title: EU to provide new $520 million military aid to Ukraine
127.article_body: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said European Union would provide a further €500 million ($520 million) worth of military support to Ukraine. The latest aid package would increase the EU's funds for Ukraine's military support to a total of €2 billion, he added. Borrell also said the bloc would soon reach an agreement on an embargo on Russian oil.

128.title: I couldn't take my eyes off her: Pratik Gandhi on working with Tanuja
128.article_body: Pratik Gandhi, speaking about working with Tanuja in 'Modern Love: Mumbai', said, "She's what charisma is described as." Recalling an incident from the shoot, Pratik said, "We'd to go up almost four flights of stairs. Building was without...lift...I thought she must have gotten tired but as...camera started rolling, her energy level was on...different high. I...couldn't take my eyes off her."

129.title: Have realised my strengths, working on them in training: MI's Sams
129.article_body: MI all-rounder Daniel Sams, who posted 3/16 against CSK in IPL 2022, said after MI lost the first few games he realised that he was focussing on the batter too much and not on his strengths. "That was something to work on at training," he added. Sams was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in MI's five wicket win over CSK.

130.title: Jailed Maha minister Nawab Malik allowed private hospital treatment
130.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, who is jailed in a money laundering case, was allowed by a special court in Mumbai to get treatment at a private hospital. Malik's lawyer had earlier told the court that he was undergoing treatment at state-run JJ Hospital in a serious condition. Malik had last month applied for bail on medical grounds for six weeks.

131.title: CSK's management not serious; if Dhoni leaves, they'll have nothing: Akhtar
131.article_body: Talking about CSK, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "CSK's management didn't look serious about IPL 2022. If MS Dhoni leaves they are left with nothing." "One really cannot predict what Dhoni can do," added Akhtar. "Only CSK can explain why they suddenly gave Ravindra Jadeja the captaincy. They need to come next season with a clear mind," stated Akhtar.

132.title: Forest Department stops development work at Pune's Taljai hill
132.article_body: The Forest Department has decided to stop developmental works being undertaken at Pune's Taljai hill, according to an official statement. Notably, the move comes after residents of Sahakar Nagar met with officials and demanded the developmental work to be stopped. The department said that it would undertake tree plantation drive at the hill during the rainy season.

133.title: 50-yr-old man rapes 2 daughters aged 18 & 24 in Ludhiana; arrested
133.article_body: A 50-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his two daughters in Ludhiana. Their mother alleged she caught her husband raping their 24-year-old daughter a few months back. When she threatened him about lodging a complaint, he had promised he won't repeat it. Later, she found that the accused had also raped her 18-year-old daughter and filed a complaint.

134.title: Aggressive act: Australia says it tracked a Chinese spy ship
134.article_body: Australia's Defence Ministry on Friday said that a Chinese naval intelligence ship had been detected off the country's western coast. The ship was in "close proximity to military and intelligence installations", Australian Defence Minister Peter Dutton said, adding that "it's an act of aggression". The Chinese vessel was not in Australian territorial waters, Australian PM Scott Morrison said.

135.title: Yuvraj Singh trolls Suresh Raina for CSK getting all out for 97 against MI
135.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled Suresh Raina after CSK got all out for 97 against MI in their IPL 2022 clash on Thursday. Yuvraj shared a video, wherein he can be seen asking Raina, "Your team has been bowled out for 97. What would you want to say?" Raina can then seemingly be heard saying, "I haven't watched the match."

136.title: Karan Kundrra registers for flat worth ₹20 crore in Bandra: Report
136.article_body: Television actor Karan Kundrra has registered for a sea-facing flat worth over ₹20 crore in a building in Mumbai's Bandra, Free Press Journal reported. As per the report, the actor's new home has its own private lift and a swimming pool. Earlier, an article showing pictures of his purported home had gone viral on social media.

137.title: Disappointing: Petitioners on Delhi HC's split verdict on marital rape
137.article_body: Women activists and petitioners have shown their disappointment after the Delhi High Court's two-judge bench gave a split verdict on the criminalisation of marital rape. "We are disappointed that...violence that the married women undergo was not taken into consideration by [HC]," All India Democratic Women's Association's member Mariam Dhawale said. "We shall...appeal to...higher court," she said.

138.title: 20 people park cars on Patna flyover to celebrate b'day; video shows bullets being fired
138.article_body: A group of more than 20 people had parked their cars on a flyover in Bihar's Patna for a birthday celebration recently, a video of which is widely being circulated online. A man could be seen firing bullets in the air in the video. Police said they've taken immediate action, adding, "Four youths, including 'birthday boy' Saurav Yadav, are arrested."

139.title: US theatre installs IR cameras to catch people filming nude scenes
139.article_body: US' Broadway theatre has installed infrared cameras pointed at the audience to see if anyone is trying to use a recording device during nude scenes. This comes after someone posted videos of actor Jesse Williams and co-star Michael Oberholtzer online that were taken during a nude scene from a play. The camera system will be monitored in real-time.

140.title: B'wood should soon be making films only for OTT: Ram Gopal Varma
140.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma on Friday took to Twitter to write, "The way South films seem to be going in theatres and North films don't...it looks like Bollywood should be soon making films only for OTT." He had earlier stated Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' is like "a large dark cloud casting a doomsday shadow on all the other big films".

141.title: Protest erupts over Kashmiri Pandit's killing in J&K; police lathicharge, use tear gas
141.article_body: Massive protests by Kashmiri Pandits erupted in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir after the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Budgam. Police resorted to lathicharge and fired tear gas shells at protesters, who were trying to move towards the Airport Road. The protesters demanded a government job for Bhat's wife and free education for his daughter.

142.title: Sohail Khan and Seema Khan file for divorce after 24 years of marriage: Report
142.article_body: Salman Khan's brother Sohail Khan and Seema Khan have filed for divorce after 24 years of marriage, said The Times of India while quoting a source. The two were spotted outside the family court in Mumbai leaving separately. They got married in 1998 and have two children. Sohail and Seema are yet to release an official statement about their divorce.

143.title: Kim lookalike crashes Australian PM's event & talks to reporters, video viral
143.article_body: A man impersonating North Korean leader Kim Jong un gatecrashed an election campaign event attended by Australian PM Scott Morrison on Friday. A video of the incident that went viral online, showed the Kim 'lookalike' talking to reporters gathered there. On being asked to leave, the impersonator said, "Excuse me, you don't tell the supreme leader what to do."

144.title: Aamir to make cameo in son Junaid's web series 'Pritam Pyare': Report
144.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan will reportedly make a cameo appearance in son Junaid Khan's debut web series 'Pritam Pyare'. According to reports, Aamir had joined Junaid and the team in Rajasthan's Bagar on May 1 where he shot for a song and some hospital scenes over the week. Notably, Junaid Khan will make his Bollywood debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

145.title: Twitter deal is temporarily on hold, tweets Elon Musk
145.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that his $44 billion deal to take Twitter private is "temporarily on hold". The deal has been put on hold "pending details supporting calculation that spam/fake accounts do indeed represent less than 5% of users", Musk said. Shares of the micro-blogging site fell over 20% in pre-market trading after Musk's tweet.

146.title: English is a global language and helps break barriers: AR Rahman
146.article_body: AR Rahman, speaking at an event on Thursday, said that English is a global language and helps break barriers. Rahman had earlier shared a Goddess Tamil poster following Home Minister Amit Shah's call for replacing English with Hindi as India's official language. "The rest of the world is waiting for India in terms of music," Rahman said at the event.

147.title: Rajkummar, Bhumi-starrer 'Bheed' to release in theatres on November 18
147.article_body: Filmmaker Anubhav Sinha's upcoming film 'Bheed', starring Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar, will be released in theatres on November 18 this year. 'Bheed' is a socio-political drama jointly produced by Anubhav Sinha and Bhushan Kumar. It was shot across Lucknow in November last year and will mark Bhumi and Rajkummar's latest collaboration post 'Badhaai Do'.

148.title: 100 meat shops sealed in north Delhi in 1 week under civic body's drive
148.article_body: Hundred meat shops in north Delhi have been sealed by North Delhi Municipal Corporation authorities within one week over violation of norms under an ongoing drive against illegal temporary structures. NDMC said it has removed around 70-80 temporary structures from areas under its jurisdiction. "Such raids would continue in coming days to curb the illegal sale of meat," it added.

149.title: Swiggy buys Dineout from Times Internet for reported $200 million
149.article_body: Swiggy on Friday announced it has entered into a definitive agreement with Times Internet to acquire dining out and restaurant tech platform Dineout for a reported $200 million. Following the acquisition, Dineout will continue to operate as an independent app and its founders will join Swiggy. Founded in 2012 by four school friends, Dineout was acquired by Times in 2014.

150.title: Biden makes $150 million commitment to ASEAN leaders
150.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday made energy and security pledges worth $150 million to Southeast Asian leaders during a two-day summit in Washington. The US-ASEAN Special Summit, held for the first time in Washington, comes as the US seeks to strengthen ties with Southeast Asian countries as part of its Indo-Pacific strategy in response to China's expansion.

151.title: Suspicious object at Pune railway station turns out to be firecracker
151.article_body: Bomb detection squads rushed to the Pune railway station on Friday after a suspicious object was found at the premises. "[It is] just a firecracker. We got it checked thoroughly. Nothing to worry about," Pune railways' Senior Divisional Security Commissioner Uday Singh Pawar said. The railway station had been evacuated after the object was found.

152.title: Leaked data shows China has jailed over 10,000 Uyghurs in Xinjiang
152.article_body: More than 10,000 Uyghurs have been imprisoned in the Xinjiang region by China, as per leaked data. The leaked data contains details about each prisoner's name, birth date, ethnicity, ID number, charge, address, sentence length, and prison. China has been repeatedly criticised by the West over the detention camps in Xinjiang, which it calls "vocational training centres".

153.title: Felt sad I couldn't marry Shammi, Kapoor family was strict with bahus: Mumtaz
153.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz said that she loved Shammi Kapoor "tremendously", adding that she "felt sad" that she couldn't marry him. "I was...around 17. He was 18 years older than me. It was too early for me to get married," Mumtaz said, adding that she wanted to achieve something and "Kapoor family was strict about their bahus not working in films".

154.title: An actor is expected to look beautiful even in death: Mumtaz
154.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz has stated that an actor is expected to look beautiful even in death, adding, "Janaaza bhi beautiful lagna chahiye (Funeral should also look beautiful)!" The actress further said that when she was undergoing cancer treatment 20 years ago, a "bloated" picture of hers was clicked and people made remarks about it like, "Mumtaz is finished."

155.title: Pakistan's common man not our opponent: Sharad Pawar recalls his Pak visit
155.article_body: During an Eid-Milan event in Pune, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar recalled his visit to Pakistan's Karachi for a cricket match. "We had taken our cricket team to Karachi...When we went to pay the bill (in a restaurant) they refused and said that we were their guests," Pawar said. "The common man of Pakistan is not our opponent," he added.

156.title: This is sad: B'luru Archbishop on K'taka anti-conversion ordinance
156.article_body: Bengaluru Archbishop Peter Machado reacted to the Karnataka Cabinet approving the anti-conversion bill and using the ordinance route to give it effect, saying, "This is sad." He also appealed to the state Governor to not give his assent to it. This will affect the "harmonious relationship that we enjoy with members of all the communities" in the state, he added.

157.title: Apple pins letters outlining employee benefits at US stores: Report
157.article_body: Apple has started publishing laminated copies of a letter in its US stores' backrooms highlighting and praising its benefits amid a union push, Bloomberg reported citing the letter. The two-page note outlines benefits such as vacation time, a 401(k) plan, product discount programs and health insurance. Each letter has been signed by the local individual managers.

158.title: SUV rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway, 5 of a pilgrim group die
158.article_body: Five people, including four women, died and two others were injured after their SUV rammed into a truck on Yamuna Expressway. The people killed in the accident were part of a pilgrimage group comprising 50 people. They were returning from Mathura and heading towards Kedarnath. While the seven were travelling in a Mahindra Bolero, the others were in a bus.

159.title: Severe dust storm turns day into night in US, residents share before-after pics
159.article_body: Severe dust storms hit Upper Midwest in US on Thursday. The sky darkened as an immense wall of dust covered the area and resulted in low visibility, turning day into night, pictures of which surfaced online. The storm intensified into a 'derecho', which is a widespread, long-lived wind storm associated with a band of rapidly moving showers or thunderstorms.

160.title: WazirX, CoinDCX delist crypto token LUNA after it crashes nearly 100%
160.article_body: Indian crypto exchanges WazirX and CoinDCX are delisting crypto token LUNA after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. LUNA crashed after its sister token, TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, lost its peg. CoinDCX said that it has also delisted UST from its app with immediate effect.

161.title: One of the toughest things: Pique on 'horrible' initiation at Man Utd
161.article_body: Sharing his experience at former club Manchester United, Barcelona defender Gerard Pique said, "I had to say who was the [team's] best and worst player. It was one of the toughest things. That was my initiation, that was horrible." "I don't remember what I said," added Pique. Pique termed Manchester United's former manager Sir Alex Ferguson as a "second dad".

162.title: Over 2,000 kg of adulterated paneer seized in Mumbai; 7 arrested
162.article_body: Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing has seized over 2,000 kilograms of adulterated paneer from Dairy Punjab in Chembur, a report said. During an investigation, it was revealed that the accused used unsweetened milk powder, light palm oil and chemicals to produce harmful and low-quality cheese, disguised as "malai paneer". Meanwhile, seven persons, including the dairy owner, have been arrested.

163.title: Manchester City unveil Aguero statue on 10th anniversary of '93:20' moment, share pics
163.article_body: Manchester City on Friday unveiled a permanent statue of Sergio Aguero at Etihad Stadium on the tenth anniversary of the iconic '93:20' moment and the club's first Premier League title. The large-scale statue was created by award-winning sculptor Andy Scott using thousands of welded pieces of galvanised steel. City had clinched the title after Aguero's 94th minute goal against QPR.

164.title: 15 including doctors, officials of Pune clinic booked for kidney transplant malpractice
164.article_body: Fifteen people, including senior management officials and doctors of Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic, have been booked in connection with alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant conducted in March. A woman was promised ₹15 lakh to pose as the wife of a man who needed a transplant. The clinic's Managing Trustee, who has also been booked, said they were being harassed.

165.title: Terrorists asked who Rahul was, then shot him: Family of Kashmiri Hindu killed in J&K
165.article_body: The family members of government employee Rahul Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu on Thursday, have demanded an inquiry into his death. "First, they (terrorists) asked who Rahul Bhat is and then they shot him," his father said. "There was a police station 100 feet away...They should check CCTV footage," Bhat's father said.

166.title: Former minister's car pushed into lake by protesting Sri Lankans; video surfaces
166.article_body: A video showing protestors pushing a car that allegedly belonged to a former minister into a lake in Sri Lanka amid political and economic crisis has surfaced online. Cars of several politicians were reportedly pushed into water. "No gas, no fuel and...essential medications, and people are suffering. People are living with one meal a day," a protestor said.

167.title: Johar gets so much hate for nepotism but he signed me when I was nobody: Kiara
167.article_body: Kiara Advani in a recent interview praised filmmaker Karan Johar for signing her when she was a "nobody" in the industry. "I know he gets so much hate for nepotism and all of that...but he took me when I was a nobody, and nobody told him to," she said. Kiara worked in Karan Johar's segment of 2018 anthology 'Lust Stories'.

168.title: 15-yr-old gang-raped in a car by 5 men in Ranchi, accused arrested
168.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped inside a car by five men in Ranchi, Jharkhand. The victim alleged that she was forced into the car which was later found by a police patrol team with her in it in the district's Daladali village, Superintendent of Police (Ranchi-Rural) Naushad Alam said. Notably, all five accused have been arrested.

169.title: 73 of India's 100 unicorns have at least 1 founder from IIT: Report
169.article_body: Data shared by analytics firm Tracxn Technologies showed that 73 of India’s 100 unicorns have at least one founder from IITs. Out of these, the founders belong to seven of the 23 IITs, with IIT Delhi in the lead. About 21 unicorns have at least one founder who is an IIT Delhi alumni, followed by IIT Bombay, with 16.

170.title: Gurugram resident booked for filing false robbery case
170.article_body: A Gurugram resident was booked by the police after the former filed a false robbery complaint. The accused, identified as Kamal Singh, had called the control room alleging that he had been robbed of ₹4 lakh at gunpoint at the city's Jharsa flyover. Notably, Singh was in debt and therefore, came up with this robbery story, police said.

171.title: Healer tortured, killed in Kerala for not revealing his piles medicine details
171.article_body: A 60-year-old Mysuru-based traditional healer, known for one-time treatment of piles, was held captive for more than a year, tortured and then murdered in Kerala after he allegedly refused to reveal the secret formula behind his medicine for piles treatment. A Malayali businessman, working in the Middle-east, and three of his accomplices were arrested by the police in the matter.

172.title: BJP leader dies by suicide at his residence in Bengaluru
172.article_body: A BJP leader from Bengaluru's Herohalli ward was found dead at his residence on Thursday. According to a primary investigation conducted by the police, the 46-year-old man had died by suicide and no foul play is suspected. The deceased's cousin claimed that he was distressed by his thyroid illness. The police were informed about the incident around 7.30 pm.

173.title: Delhi, Mumbai could be 5°C warmer in 2080-99 than 1995-2014: Report
173.article_body: The mean annual temperature of Delhi and Mumbai will be 5°C higher in between 2080-99 as compared to the 1995-2014 period if global CO2 emissions double by 2050, Greenpeace India reported. Delhi's annual maximum temperature will jump to 45.97°C in the 2080-99 period. Chennai's annual maximum temperature will increase from 35.13°C at present to 38.78°C in the 2080-99 period.

174.title: 'Take tough decisions,' Sanjay Raut slams Centre over Kashmiri Pandit's killing
174.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has slammed the central government over the targeted killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam. "If even after the abrogation of Article 370...Kashmiri Pandits are not returning and those living in Kashmir are not safe. You (Centre) have to take tough decisions to end...instability that is building in J&K," Raut said.
