175.title: NIA arrests 2 from Mumbai for alleged links with Dawood's gang
175.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Thursday arrested two people, Arif Abubakar Shaikh (59) and Shabbir Abubakar Shaikh (51) in connection with a case against fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides. NIA said the accused were close to gangster Chhota Shakeel and involved in illegal activities of Dawood's D-gang. NIA questioned them for four days before making the arrest.

176.title: Don't need certificate of patriotism from Yogi, BJP: Owaisi
176.article_body: Reacting to UP government's new order of making national anthem mandatory in the state's madrassas, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that Yogi Adityanath and BJP looked at madrassas with suspicion. "We tell Yogi Adityanath and BJP that don't give us the certificate of patriotism," he added. There was no Sangh Parivar when country was fighting for freedom, Owaisi further said.

177.title: Emily Blunt to star in criminal conspiracy film 'Pain Hustlers'
177.article_body: Actress Emily Blunt will be playing the lead role in the criminal conspiracy film 'Pain Hustlers'. The film will be directed by David Yates who is known for directing four films in the 'Harry Potter' series and the first three films of the series 'Fantastic Beasts'. Written by Wells Tower, 'Pain Hustlers' will go on floors on August 22.

178.title: SoftBank to cut fundings by half this yr after $26 bn Vision Fund loss
178.article_body: SoftBank may cut its startup investments this fiscal year by half or even a quarter of what it did in 2021, CEO Masayoshi Son said on an earnings call. The move follows a record loss reported by SoftBank's Vision Fund that stood at $26 billion for FY22. The firm had posted a record quarterly profit a year ago.

179.title: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales resigns amid tax evasion probe
179.article_body: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales, Sunil Baby, has resigned. The company said he decided to move on for personal reasons. Notably, there has been a report of tax officials freezing deposits worth $478 million lying in local bank accounts of Xiaomi in February as part of a probe into alleged tax evasion.

180.title: Sanya Malhotra, Rajkummar's 'HIT-The First Case' to release on July 15
180.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra announced on Friday that her upcoming film 'HIT-The First Case' will release on July 15 this year. The actress also shared a picture on Instagram with co-star Rajkummar Rao and director Sailesh Kolanu while making the announcement. 'HIT-The First Case' is the Hindi remake of the Telugu mystery action thriller of the same name.

181.title: Kim Jong-un seen wearing mask for the 1st time as N Korea reports COVID outbreak
181.article_body: Kim Jong-un was seen wearing a facial mask for the first time as he held a meeting with officials to discuss the COVID-19 outbreak in North Korea. In the past, everyone but the leader wore a mask. North Korea announced its first COVID-19 outbreak more than two years into the pandemic on Thursday, with Kim ordering a strict national lockdown.

182.title: I hope Du Plessis has told Kohli 'Go back 10 years, forget what you've done': Vaughan
182.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor form in IPL 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan urged Kohli to "show some youthfulness". Vaughan added, "I hope Faf du Plessis has spoken to him and told him 'Go back 10 years, when you didn't have this profile. You're not married and don't have a kid...Forget your age, forget what you have done'."

183.title: Brendon McCullum appointed England's Test team head coach
183.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum has been appointed the head coach of England's Test team. "I strongly believe in my ability to help the team emerge as a stronger force once we've confronted them head-on," McCullum said. He added, "Ben Stokes is the perfect character to inspire change around him and I look forward to working closely with him."

184.title: Rare pic of Karan Johar in non-designer clothes: Farah shares throwback pic
184.article_body: Farah Khan took to Instagram to share an old picture featuring Farhan Akhtar, Sajid Khan, Karan Johar, Rani Mukerji and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. "Housewarming 2001 at the first home I bought," she wrote. "Aishwarya had come straight from 'Devdas' shoot thus sindoor and rare pic of Karan Johar in non-designer clothes," Farah added with a 'winking face with tongue emoji'.

185.title: First Russian soldier to go on trial in Ukraine for war crimes
185.article_body: Ukraine has disclosed plans to hold the first war crimes trial over Russia's ongoing invasion. The trial will bring to stand a 21-year-old Russian soldier, Vadim Shishimarin, accused of firing an automatic rifle from a car, killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian on February 28 to prevent him from reporting a group of soldiers, Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova's office said.

186.title: I'll be suspended for 6 months if I talk: Arteta on refereeing in Arsenal's loss
186.article_body: Talking about the refereeing in Arsenal's 0-3 loss against Tottenham Hotspur, Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said, "If I say what I think I am suspended for six months...Ask the referee to come here and explain his decisions." "Such a beautiful game was destroyed," added Arteta. "I am allowed to give my interpretation...but I do not like to lie," stated Arteta.

187.title: BJP-ruled MCDs plan to demolish 63 lakh houses: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
187.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday claimed that BJP-ruled Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) plan to demolish 63 lakh houses using bulldozers in an anti-encroachment drive. He alleged that this will leave almost 70% of Delhi's population homeless. He also wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the matter and urged him to stop the demolition.

188.title: Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have meltdowns: Co-creator
188.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to say, "I...enjoy that Elon Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have pointless meltdowns because he isn't talking about their arbitrary crypto of choice, cloaked by frail moral superiority." Markus' tweet followed Musk's reply to another tweet by him. "It [Dogecoin] has potential as a currency," Musk had said.

189.title: AAP alleges elderly man asked to leave Haryana minister's grievance meet
189.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has alleged that an elderly man was asked to leave a public grievances redressal meeting chaired by BJP minister Om Prakash Yadav in Haryana's Rewari. "When an elder raised the issue of his land...the...minister and...policemen misbehaved with the old man and threw him out," AAP tweeted while sharing a video of the alleged incident.

190.title: Westerners think we've maharajas and snake charmers only: Priyanka's mom
190.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu spoke about why her daughter keeps the Indian culture alive in her US home and said, "She wants to educate them that you've...misinformation about India." She added Westerners think "we've maharajas...and snake charmers only". "We've best education, IT & medical technology...Our rituals...have so much good behind them. She...tries to keep it up there," said Madhu.

191.title: I imitated Britney Spears, my mother was so 'shocked': Novak Djokovic
191.article_body: Discussing his previous imitation experiences, world number one Novak Djokovic said, "When [I was] at the Players Show in Monte Carlo, I imitated [singer] Britney Spears. I had denim shorts and a wig, my mother was so shocked." "After that I had to stop for a while," added Djokovic. "Maybe I [will] go back to doing imitations," stated Djokovic.

192.title: India will be free of those who talk of Congress-free country: Gehlot
192.article_body: Congress leader and Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that India will be free of those who talk of Congress-free country. Ahead of Congress' three-day Chintan Shivir, Gehlot said, "The country is passing through a critical period. Indira Gandhi, Rajiv Gandhi and Beant Singh were martyred. But today, the people in power ask what happened in the last 70 years."

193.title: Police forced me to leave Udaipur ahead of Cong's 'Chintan Shivir': BJP MP
193.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur, BJP MP Kirodi Lal Meena has alleged that he was forcefully shifted from Udaipur by the police. "SP came with a heavy police force and removed me without any reason (from Udaipur)...They just said that I am not allowed," Meena said. "This is a violation of my constitutional rights," he added.

194.title: Max temp likely to fall by 2-3 degrees in Delhi from Monday
194.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted that the maximum temperature of Delhi could fall by 2-3°C from Monday onwards. However, the heatwave-like conditions are expected to continue in the capital till Sunday, the IMD said. The maximum temperature is going to be around 44°C during this period. Notably, the Air Quality Index will remain in the 'moderate' category.

195.title: Police officer martyred in terrorist attack at his house in J&K
195.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday said that Constable Reyaz Ahmad Thoker was martyred after terrorists fired at him at his residence in Pulwama. Thoker succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, police added. This is the second shooting incident in the Union Territory in the last 24 hours. Earlier, a Kashmiri Pandit was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam.

196.title: Don't know his diagnosis, he has had fever for last 2 weeks: Shane Watson on Prithvi Shaw
196.article_body: Delhi Capitals assistant coach Shane Watson has hinted that Prithvi Shaw could also miss his team's remaining IPL 2022 matches. "It's not looking great. I don't know his diagnosis exactly but he's had...fever for the last two weeks," he said. Recently, Shaw had shared a picture of himself from a hospital bed. DC will next face PBKS on Monday.

197.title: NASA releases night-time image showing 'heat islands' in & near Delhi
197.article_body: NASA has released a night-time image taken on May 5 by its Ecosystem Spaceborne Thermal Radiometer Experiment on Space Station instrument, showing "heat islands" in and near Delhi. Night-time temperatures in Delhi and several smaller villages were peaking at about 39°C, while the rural fields nearby had cooled to around 15°C. The image covers about 12,350 square kilometres.

198.title: Near consensus on one family, one ticket proposal: Congress ahead of 'Chintan Shivir'
198.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Chintan Shivir', AICC general secretary Ajay Maken said, "On the one family, one ticket proposal there is near consensus." "No person should be in a post for more than five years and there should be a cooling off period for three years," Maken added. "A wing will be set up for assessing leaders' performance," he further said.

199.title: It was a big mistake by MS Dhoni to step down as CSK captain: Kaif
199.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MS Dhoni's decision to step down as CSK captain ahead of IPL 2022 was a "big" mistake. "If Dhoni's in the playing XI, he should be captain. Ravindra Jadeja...[wasn't] ready for...captaincy," added Kaif. Jadeja handed back CSK captaincy to Dhoni after the team lost six of their first eight IPL 2022 matches under his leadership.

200.title: Imagine what PBKS players are feeling about constant changes: Ajay Jadeja
200.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said it has become "very hard" to assess PBKS. "When we...are confused with the constant changes, imagine what the players might be feeling," added Ajay. "I never expected [PBKS coach] Anil Kumble to bench Shahrukh Khan for Rishi Dhawan," stated Ajay. "There is an inconsistency in the thought process...and that is being reflected," said Ajay.

201.title: Rachakonda Police arrests 2 men for cheating MBBS aspirant of ₹12 lakh
201.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two men for allegedly cheating an MBBS aspirant of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of providing a seat in a medical institution. According to police, the accused contacted MBBS aspirants and offered seats in coveted medical colleges. They then induced such aspirants to pay a huge sum of money in exchange for the seat, police added.

202.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from May 13 to 15
202.article_body: Several areas of Bengaluru will face power outages from May 13 to May 15 as the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out maintenance and repair works during this period. The maintenance work will be carried out between May 13 and May 15 as maximum offices remain closed on weekends which decreases the load on the grid.

203.title: Motorola announces edge 30 as the world’s thinnest 5G phone
203.article_body: Aiming to disrupt India's premium smartphone market, Motorola has announced the launch of edge 30 as the world's thinnest 5G phone with 6.79 mm thickness & 155 gm weight. The smartphone, starting at ₹25,999* offers flagship features like 144Hz 10-bit pOLED display & India's first Snapdragon 778G+. It goes on sale starting May 19 on Flipkart & Reliance Digital stores.

204.title: Will create chaos: Supreme Court as it refuses to postpone NEET PG 2022 exam
204.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea that sought the postponement of NEET PG 2022 exam. The court observed that postponing the exam will create chaos and uncertainty, while impacting patient care and treatment. The apex court also said that it cannot cause hardships to thousands of students who have been preparing for the exams because of some others.

205.title: CSK captaincy took a heavy toll on Ravindra Jadeja: Lalchand Rajput
205.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput said CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja could not perform well in IPL 2022 as captaincy took a "heavy toll" on him. "CSK will miss the services of Jadeja as he was an important player," added Rajput. Jadeja has been ruled out of IPL 2022, owing to a bruised rib during CSK's defeat against RCB on May 4.

206.title: BJP wants to create a different type of Taliban system in India: Shiv Sena
206.article_body: The Shiv Sena criticised BJP saying that the party wants to create a different type of Taliban system in this country. BJP is playing politics of bigotry which can disturb peace of the nation, Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'. The Sena further said that BJP's Hindutva is an experiment to take the country back a thousand years.

207.title: Want to thank PM Modi for economic assistance: Sri Lanka's new PM
207.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe thanked PM Narendra Modi for providing economic assistance to the country and said he looks forward to closer ties with India. Wickremesinghe was sworn in as PM on Thursday to stabilise the country's debt-ridden economy and end the political turmoil. India has provided assistance of over $3.5 billion to Sri Lanka this year alone.

208.title: No harm in dreaming: Sehwag on PBKS' chances of reaching IPL 2022 playoffs
208.article_body: Discussing PBKS' chances of reaching the IPL 2022 playoffs, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said there is "no harm" in dreaming. "They will have to believe that they can win...and that is something I have not seen...so far," added Sehwag. Discussing PBKS' match against RCB, Sehwag stated, "It is crucial that PBKS win. However, they don't win important matches anyway."

209.title: Get highly qualified experts to build your investment portfolio: dezerv.
209.article_body: Wealth-tech firm dezerv. aims to save your time and strategically manage your hard-earned money. Its experts with 20+ years of experience do all the heavy-lifting of researching, optimizing, and rebalancing your personalised investment portfolio that they build for you, it stated. Focus your time on what you do best, and let the experts secure your future, says co-founder Sandeep Jethwani.

210.title: Las Vegas casino gives ₹3.86 lakh bonus to each of its 5,400 employees
210.article_body: A Las Vegas casino has announced a $5,000 (around ₹3.86 lakh) bonus for all its 5,400 employees. "It's you, every single day, that makes a difference....Whether you clean the rooms, cook the food, dealing cards, serving drinks, at the front desk." said Daniel Espino, Cosmopolitan chief people officer. The all-employee bonus will cost us more than $27 million, company said.

211.title: Houses develop cracks amid metro work in Kolkata; 82 evacuated
211.article_body: At least 82 people have been shifted to nearby hotels after several houses in the Bowbazar area in Kolkata developed cracks amid the ongoing underground metro construction work, according to police. Earlier in 2019, several buildings in the area collapsed during metro construction work. "We're examining whether it is safe to let these buildings stand," Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim said.

212.title: Rahul gets relief from HC in case for calling Amit Shah 'murder accused'
212.article_body: The Jharkhand High Court granted relief to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in 2019 case for allegedly using derogatory remarks against Amit Shah and calling him a "murder accused". The HC has ordered no coercive action against Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case. The court stayed proceedings of a lower court in the matter and issued a notice to petitioner.

213.title: Mumbai Police busts sex racket at Worli spa, 3 women rescued
213.article_body: Mumbai Police raided a spa for running a sex racket and rescued three women in Worli. The decoy customer was asked to pick one of the women and told to pay ₹1000 for massage and additional ₹2000 for the woman's service. One of the women told police that the owner and manager kept a huge chunk of money earned.

214.title: SSLC exam results to be declared on May 19: Karnataka Education Minister
214.article_body: The results of Karnataka SSLC board exams will be declared on May 19, state Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh announced on Friday. The results will be available at sslc.karnataka.gov.in and karresults.nic.in. Notably, over 8 lakh students had registered for the SSLC exams that were held between March 28 and April 11.

215.title: Pat Cummins ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
215.article_body: KKR pacer Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the remaining IPL 2022 matches due to a hip injury. Cummins will fly back to Sydney and complete his rehabilitation before Australia's tour of Sri Lanka. Cummins took seven wickets in five IPL 2022 matches. He also smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL off 14 deliveries against MI this season.

216.title: Bride and groom set themselves on fire during wedding exit stunt in US; video viral
216.article_body: A video showing a bride and groom setting themselves on fire as they exited their wedding reception this week in US has gone viral on social media. Professional stunt doubles Gabe Jessop and Ambyr Bambyr met each other while working on the sets of Hollywood films. "These are trained professionals, don't try this at home," a wedding organiser said.

217.title: Sanctions hurting West more than Russia: Putin
217.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Western countries were more hit by sanctions imposed on Russia over its military operation in Ukraine than Moscow. The sanctions are "driven by oversized political ambitions and Russophobia", he added. Putin claimed that Russia is coping with "external challenges" provoked by Western sanctions and the inflation in the country is slowing down.

218.title: SpaceX shows Starlink's availability globally, India marked 'coming soon'
218.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX updated Starlink's availability globally, saying, "Starlink is now available in 32 countries around the world." It also released a map showing nations where the service is on the waitlist and others where it's expected to come soon. India, along with its neighbours Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan, was marked under 'coming soon'.

219.title: Gold worth ₹29 lakh concealed with rhodium coating seized at Hyd airport
219.article_body: The Hyderabad Customs on Thursday detected and seized 551.21 grams of gold worth ₹29.15 lakh from a male passenger at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The gold was concealed with rhodium coating and fitted to two ladies handbags placed in the check-in baggage, Customs officials said. The passenger had arrived from Kuwait, they added.

220.title: LIC sets IPO issue price at ₹949; listing likely on Tuesday: Report
220.article_body: LIC has set its IPO issue price at ₹949 a share, at the top of its indicated range of ₹902-949, as per a report. It is likely to be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The country's largest-ever IPO opened on May 4 and was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding on May 9.

221.title: He was such an elegant man: Chris Pratt recalls working with Irrfan
221.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt in an interview opened up about working with Irrfan Khan in the 2015 film 'Jurassic World' and said, "He was...such an elegant man." "It's really a rare combination for there to be such strength in softness...And that's what I'd call elegant - he could do very little, and still, he'd be doing so much," Chris added.

222.title: Putin humiliating himself on the world stage: UK
222.article_body: International sanctions against Russia should only be lifted when all of its troops have left Ukraine, UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss told a meeting of G7 foreign ministers in Germany. "[Russian President Vladimir] Putin is humiliating himself on the world stage. We must ensure he faces...defeat in Ukraine that denies him any benefit and ultimately constrains further aggression," she added.

223.title: Stones pelted by 200 people at wedding procession due to social boycott: Guj police
223.article_body: Two people were injured after 200 people allegedly stone pelted a Dalit groom's wedding procession taken out at a village in Gujarat's Patan on Thursday. The incident was due to a "social boycott", police said. The gram panchayat had decided seven to eight years ago that wedding processions won't be taken out as an "austerity measure", SP Vijay Patel said.

224.title: CM Mann condemns trend of gun culture, gangsterism in Punjabi songs
224.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday condemned the trend of gun culture and gangsterism in Punjabi songs. He urged singers to "desist from fanning violence, hatred and animosity in the society through their songs". He further said, "Initially, we request them not to prop up such trend, failing which the government would be forced to act sternly against them."

225.title: Tesla shares drop by 26% ever since Musk offered to buy Twitter
225.article_body: Shares of Tesla have slipped by 26% ever since its CEO and world’s richest person Elon Musk offered to takeover Twitter on April 14. The shares have plunged on the fears that Musk will get distracted with Twitter. Meanwhile, shares of Twitter slipped to $45.23 on Thursday, nearly 20% below Musk’s offer price of $54.20 per share.

226.title: Former Union minister Pandit Sukh Ram cremated with full state honours in Mandi
226.article_body: Former Union Telecommunication Minister Pandit Sukh Ram was cremated with full state honours at Hanumanghat in Mandi on Thursday. Thousands of his followers gathered to pay last tributes to the leader at Seri Manch, where his mortal remains were kept. His son MLA Anil Sharma, grandson Aayush Sharma with wife Arpita and brother-in-law Salman Khan among others, attended the funeral.

227.title: Russian logistics ship on fire in Black Sea after strike: Ukraine
227.article_body: A Russian logistics ship caught fire after being struck near Snake Island, a small but strategic outpost in the Black Sea, a Ukrainian official said. The vessel, Vsevolod Bobrov, was left "limping" back to Sevastopol port, Serhiy Bratchuk, spokesman for the Odesa Regional Military Administration, said. "Vsevolod Bobrov...is one of the newest in the Russian fleet," Serhiy added.

228.title: Most dumb thing: Musk on hydrogen as tool for energy storage
228.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview dismissed hydrogen's use for energy storage, saying it's "the most dumb thing I could possibly imagine for energy storage". "I really can't emphasise this enough...Hydrogen is a bad choice," he said. He argued that "gigantic tanks" would be needed for storing hydrogen in liquid form, and gaseous form would need "even bigger" ones.

229.title: 19-yr-old biker dies while trying to avoid collision with cyclist in Mumbai
229.article_body: A 19-year-old biker died while trying to avoid a collision with a cyclist, coming from the opposite end, on a bridge in Mumbai's Bhayandar area. The deceased, identified as Jebas Nadar, was heading towards Mira Road with his friend, Sunil Pariyar (19), who suffered minor injuries. Notably, an FIR has been lodged against Nadar on Pariyar's complaint, police said.

230.title: Umpire trolled for changing signal from wide to out within seconds after CSK's appeal
230.article_body: On-field umpire Chirra Ravikanthreddy has been trolled for changing his signal from wide to out within seconds after CSK appealed for a caught-behind against MI's Hrithik Shokeen. The decision was overturned by DRS. "Umpire has got no clue...Going by the vibe of the appeal," a user tweeted. "This is officially the worst piece of umpiring I have seen," wrote another.

231.title: 4 booked in Thane for forging land documents to get ₹47 lakh compensation
231.article_body: Thane police have booked four unidentified persons for allegedly forging land documents to receive a compensation of over ₹47 lakh from the government. The accused submitted fake documents in the name of deceased persons for compensation in return for land acquired for a dam in Ambernath. The incident came to light when the legal heirs approached irrigation department for compensation.

232.title: Spain planning 3-day menstrual leave per month for women with severe pain
232.article_body: Spain is planning to introduce medical leave for women who suffer from severe period pain, according to a draft bill. The bill says women could have three days of leave a month - extended to five in some circumstances. Politicians have said that the draft, leaked to Spanish media outlets, was still being worked on.

233.title: Million-dollar mansions destroyed by wildfire in US; pics surface
233.article_body: Hundreds of people have been forced to evacuate from their homes due to a wildfire in US' California that has destroyed million-dollar mansions. The fire in Orange County, that has torched 20 mansions so far, has grown to 199 acres since it began on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the largest wildfire in the US has burned 170 homes in New Mexico.

234.title: Apply for loudspeaker permit by May 25: Bengaluru Police
234.article_body: The Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant asked people and establishments who require licence to use loudspeakers to submit an application on any working day to the jurisdictional Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACPs) by May 25. The jurisdictional ACPs have been designated as the licensing authority and enforcement officer for the use of loudspeakers, as per the release.

235.title: ₹10 lakh extorted from ex-deputy mayor of Gurugram; 2 arrested
235.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from the former senior deputy mayor of Gurugram and BJP leader, Yashpal Batra (39). The accused were allegedly involved in sending a "fake" summon notice from the ED and the CBI asking Batra to appear before them. Notably, Batra was threatened that his bank accounts would get freeze, police said.

236.title: Terrorism resurgent in Afghanistan, could become global threat again: UN
236.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that terrorism is resurgent in Afghanistan and could become a global threat again. "Terrorism is not only an attack on innocent people. It represents an all-out assault on human rights," Guterres added. "Responses to terrorism must be anchored in the rule of law, human rights, and gender equality to ensure their effectiveness," he further said.

237.title: Lost Babri Masjid, don't want to lose another: Owaisi on Gyanvapi mosque case
237.article_body: Reacting to Varanasi court's order to complete videographic survey of Gyanvapi mosque premises by May 17, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that the order of court is a "blatant violation" of Places of Worship Act 1991 and violation of SC's judgement in Babri Masjid dispute. "I have lost one Babri Masjid and I don't want to lose another," he added.

238.title: I'm concerned about my family's safety: Gyanvapi mosque case judge
238.article_body: Civil Judge Ravi Kumar Diwakar, who ordered the continuation of the survey of Uttar Pradesh's Gyanvapi mosque, on Thursday said that an “atmosphere of fear was created by making this civil case into an extraordinary case”. "The fear is so much that my family is always concerned about my safety and I am concerned about their safety," he added.

239.title: I'll never say I'm alone in industry: Kangana as Salman shares Dhaakad trailer
239.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to thank Salman Khan for sharing a trailer of her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad'. "Wishing team #Dhaakad the very best," Salman wrote while sharing the trailer on his social media handles. "Thank you my Dabangg hero, heart of gold. I'll never say again that I'm alone in this industry...thank you from...entire Dhaakad team," Kangana responded.

240.title: Meta, Twitter asked to store proof of potential Russian war crimes
240.article_body: Four Democratic lawmakers have asked the CEOs of YouTube, TikTok, Twitter and Meta to archive content that could be used as evidence of potential Russian war crimes in Ukraine. In their letter, the lawmakers said such content "could potentially be used as evidence as the US...and international human rights and accountability monitors investigate Russian...crimes...and other atrocities in Ukraine".

241.title: Asked bowlers to show a lot of character vs MI, forget about result: Dhoni
241.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said he asked his bowlers to show a "lot" of character, put the opposition under pressure and forget about the result, while attempting to defend 97-run total in his team's loss against MI. "Irrespective of how the wicket is, anything below 130 is difficult to defend," added Dhoni. Dhoni stated CSK's batters should've applied themselves better.

242.title: It was tense when we lost wickets upfront: Rohit on MI's win vs CSK
242.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said that the atmosphere was tense when his team lost wickets upfront while chasing a 98-run target against CSK. "After losing...wickets...we were calm and got the job done," added Rohit. Talking about MI all-rounder Tilak Varma who scored 34*, Rohit stated, "He [will soon]...be an all-format player for India." MI defeated CSK by five wickets.

243.title: Employee fired by Twitter changes bio to 'unemployed'; thanks team members
243.article_body: The second top executive who was fired by Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has changed his Twitter bio to ‘unemployed’. In a now deleted tweet, Bruce Falck, who oversaw revenue, had written, “I'll clarify that I too was fired by (Parag)." Falck later thanked his team in a tweet thread and said he can't wait to see their future work.

244.title: Robots may assemble UK's demonstrator solar power plant in space
244.article_body: The UK Space Energy Initiative has established a 12-year development plan that could lead to robots assembling a demonstrator solar power plant in orbit. This plant will beam gigawatts of power from space to Earth as early as 2035, the initiative's chairman said. The initiative was launched last year to explore options to develop a space-based solar plant.

245.title: Congress expels former Union Minister KV Thomas for 'anti-party' activities
245.article_body: Congress on Thursday expelled former Union Minister KV Thomas for alleged "anti-party" activities, said KPCC chief K Sudhakaran. The decision came hours after Thomas shared stage with CPI(M) leader and Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in a bypoll meeting of the left party-led front. Thomas had said he would campaign for LDF candidate Jo Joseph in the upcoming Thrikkakara Assembly bypoll.

246.title: Pune businessman cheated of ₹12.5 lakh by online fraudster
246.article_body: A Pune-based businessman was allegedly duped of ₹12.5 lakh by an online fraudster after the latter made the victim download a 'remote desktop' software on the promise of generating huge profits. The FIR has been registered under IPC Sections 419, 420 and 34. Notably, the 58-year-old victim first came in contact with the fraudster in October 2021.

247.title: Home away from home: Katrina shares pic with Vicky from Priyanka's NY restaurant
247.article_body: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal recently visited Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. Taking to Instagram Stories, Katrina shared a picture from the restaurant, writing, "Home away from home...loved the vibe. Priyanka, as always everything you do is just amazing." Priyanka reacted to Katrina's post, writing, "Love you honey! So glad you guys could make it."

248.title: Is the generator only for stadium lights: Sehwag on DRS incident in CSK-MI match
248.article_body: Talking about CSK's Devon Conway not being able to use DRS against MI due to power cut, Virender Sehwag said, "Is the generator only for stadium lights and not for...broadcasters and their systems?"  He added, "If the match was happening...DRS should definitely have been used or DRS shouldn't have been used in...entire match because this was a disadvantage for CSK."

249.title: India reports 2,841 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 18,604
249.article_body: India has reported 2,841 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,827 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 18,604, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,190, according to the latest data.

250.title: 630-foot-deep giant sinkhole with forest at the bottom discovered in China
250.article_body: A 630-foot-deep giant sinkhole with a forest at the bottom has been discovered in China's Leye County, the Xinhua news agency reported. Zhang Yuanhai, senior engineer at the Institute of Karst Geology of China Geological Survey, said that there are three caves within the sinkhole. "This is cool news," said an official from US' National Cave and Karst Research Institute.

251.title: Europe should pay more: Trump criticises US' $40 bn aid bill for Ukraine
251.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has criticised President Joe Biden's request for an additional $40 billion in aid to war-hit Ukraine, which is currently making its way through Congress. "Why are we giving over $40 billion to Ukraine while Europe, by comparison, is giving very little, and they're greatly more impacted by a Russian invasion, obviously, than...US," Trump said.

252.title: Couple attempts suicide outside Mumbai's Mantralaya, detained by police
252.article_body: A couple from Maharashtra's Nanded attempted suicide by pouring kerosene on themselves outside Mumbai's Mantralaya building, an official said. Raju Hulgude, the man who attempted suicide with his wife, had allegedly not received payment from the public works department for road construction work carried out by him. The police arrested the couple and they are being counselled, the official said.

253.title: 18-yr-old suffers eye injury after stray cow attacks him in Vadodara
253.article_body: An 18-year-old youth suffered serious eye injuries after a stray cow's horn pierced into his eye while he was riding a two-wheeler in Vadodara on Wednesday. The cow suddenly jumped from the road divider and collided with Henil Patel on the road. Following this, his two-wheeler skidded, throwing him to the ground. Passersby rushed him to a nearby hospital.

254.title: Punjab man dies after taking drugs, friends dump his body in drain
254.article_body: The body of a 25-year-old missing man suspected to have died after drug consumption was recovered from a drain by Moga Police on Thursday. According to police, Amandeep Singh's three friends, who allegedly gave him drugs, panicked after he died. They stuffed his body in a gunny bag and threw it in a drain. He went missing on May 8.

255.title: Not planning company-wide layoffs: Twitter CEO to staff after 2 executives fired
255.article_body: After Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal fired two top executives and froze hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s takeover, he shared a memo with this staff. He wrote that while no "company-wide layoffs" are planned, "leaders will continue making changes" to improve efficiencies as needed. He added, "It’s​​ critical to have the right leaders at the right time."

256.title: Crypto billionaire reveals 7.6% stake in trading app Robinhood
256.article_body: Cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried has revealed a 7.6% stake in Robinhood Markets, filings revealed. Bankman-Fried has said he doesn't have any intention of taking control of Robinhood. However, the filing also said he may "from time to time engage in discussions" with management. Shares of Robinhood were up more than 27% in after-hours trading following the disclosure.

257.title: Joe Biden was elected as people wanted less drama: Elon Musk
257.article_body: World’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that US President Joe Biden’s "mistake is that he thinks he was elected to transform the country, but actually everyone just wanted less drama." Earlier, Musk had also said that he would reverse Twitter’s ban on former US President Donald Trump and said that the ban was "morally wrong".

258.title: Bombay HC allows woman to terminate 28-week pregnancy
258.article_body: The Bombay High Court allowed a woman to terminate her pregnancy in the 28th week after her foetus was diagnosed with serious anomalies. There was risk of serious physical disabilities with very high morbidity and mortality, the doctors said. The Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act permits pregnancy termination until 20th week, beyond which permission has to be sought from HC.

259.title: US, UK agree to collaborate on commercial spaceflight missions
259.article_body: The British government has announced that the US and Britain have agreed to collaborate on future commercial spaceflight missions. It said the partnership will make spaceflight easier and cheaper. The two nations will collaborate on the licensing of commercial space launches and provide benefits including critical defence security and better weather forecasts.

260.title: Man, his parents & brother kill wife over dowry in Pune; booked
260.article_body: Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad Police have booked a man, his parents and his brother for the alleged murder of his wife over dowry. The woman's body, which the accused had purportedly dumped on the railway track near Kasarwadi railway station, was found in March. The case was filed under Sections 120 B (criminal conspiracy), 302 (murder) and 304 B (dowry death).

261.title: 3 severely injured as gas stove explodes at laundry shop in Thane
261.article_body: Three men of a family suffered serious injuries after a gas stove exploded at their laundry shop in Thane's Diva on Thursday. According to officials from Regional Disaster Management Cell, the mishap occurred around 2.40 pm when the three were having lunch. "Hiraman...suffered 55% burn injuries, Puran has 75% burn injuries and Ajay has 65% burn injuries," an official said.

262.title: 11 drown as Haitian migrant boat capsizes near Puerto Rico
262.article_body: At least 11 people have drowned and 31 others have been rescued after a boat carrying migrants from Haiti capsized near Puerto Rico, the US Coast Guard said on Thursday. It wasn't immediately clear how many people were aboard the vessel when it turned over, Coast Guard spokesman Ricardo Castrodad said, adding that a "mass rescue effort" was still underway.

263.title: Mysterious metal balls fall from space in Gujarat, pics surface
263.article_body: Mysterious metal balls fell from space at four different locations in Gujarat's Anand district. Residents reportedly rushed out of their homes fearing an earthquake after hearing a loud sound. As per police, the objects are believed to be fragments of a satellite. The metal balls have been sent to a forensic science laboratory, police added.

264.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as CSK get eliminated from playoffs race?
264.article_body: CSK have been eliminated from IPL 2022 playoffs race after losing to MI on Thursday. CSK are ninth on the points table with eight points from 12 matches, while MI are placed last with six points. LSG (16), RR (14), RCB (14), DC (12), SRH (10), KKR (10) and PBKS (10) are in contention for the remaining playoffs spots.

265.title: We are in close touch with India on standing up against Russian aggression: US
265.article_body: The US continues to be in close touch with India about its efforts to rally the world to stand up against Russian aggression, the White House said on Thursday. "That means implementing and abiding by sanctions that have been put in place," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at her daily news conference.

266.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid attending a book event in Bengaluru goes viral
266.article_body: A picture of India head coach Rahul Dravid attending a book event has gone viral on Twitter. A Twitter user, Kashy, narrated how Dravid walked in alone to the event and sat in last row before being asked by Gundappa Viswanath to sit in the first row. "Hats off to his simplicity," a user commented. "Dravid epitomises humility," wrote another.

267.title: 213 spun pole transformers put up to save public space in B'luru
267.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has installed 213 of the 2,587 transformers with single spun poles to help save public space. "The idea is that the transformers...constructed on drains and footpaths over three-four poles will be replaced with the newly designed ones," an official said. According to BESCOM, it has carried out maintenance of 4,802 transformers till May 11.

268.title: Not how I imagined leaving Twitter: Executive who was sacked during paternity leave
268.article_body: The Twitter executive who led the company's consumer division and was fired by CEO Parag Agrawal, revealed that he is currently on his paternity leave. Kayvon Beykpour tweeted, "This isn't how and when I imagined leaving Twitter...this wasn't my decision. Parag asked me to leave after letting me know that he wants to take the team in a different direction."

269.title: 3,50,000 people treated for fever, 6 died: N Korea after COVID-19 outbreak
269.article_body: After acknowledging a COVID-19 outbreak, North Korea said that six people died and 3,50,000 have been treated for a fever that has spread "explosively" across the nation. It added that 18,000 people were newly found with fever symptoms on Thursday alone, and 1,87,800 people are being isolated. One of the six people who died was confirmed infected with Omicron variant.

270.title: Twitter fires 2 top executives, freezes hiring ahead of Musk's takeover
270.article_body: Twitter on Thursday confirmed it has fired two of its senior executives who oversaw consumer and revenue divisions and has paused hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover of the company. CEO Parag Agrawal in a memo to his employees also said Twitter will review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".

271.title: Manipal University Jaipur offers UGC-entitled online degrees
271.article_body: NAAC A+ accredited Manipal University Jaipur offers UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, MCA, B.Com, BBA, BCA, etc. It invites students to get a degree while working or pursuing other commitments and benefit from offerings like scholarships, a vast alumni network, free access to Coursera, and additional professional certification courses worth ₹50,000, encouraging them to book their seats soon.

272.title: 7 held over online investment fraud in MP, ₹50 lakh found in account
272.article_body: Police arrested seven persons for cheating people on the pretext of an online investment in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and recovered two cheque books, 19 keypad mobile phones and nine android phones. The accused confessed that they randomly called people and asked them to invest in the share market, police said. Over ₹50 lakh was credited to their account, police added.

273.title: India in relatively stronger position than many nations: Finance Secy
273.article_body: India is economically in a relatively stronger position than many other countries, Finance Secretary TV Somanathan said. He stated that owing to the large domestic production of wheat, India has at least escaped the global foodgrain crisis amid Ukraine-Russia war. However, he added that India cannot be immune to geopolitical challenges as it's part of the global economy.

274.title: I never called Zeeshan Khan a terrorist on 'Lock Upp': Payal Rohatgi
274.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi has denied calling Zeeshan Khan a terrorist on the reality show. "Many statements, not just mine, were interpreted in different ways throughout the show. Zeeshan is a good boy and was a strong competition," she added. Earlier Zeeshan, after eviction, has said, "The halal meat topic went on to Payal calling me a terrorist."

275.title: BJP alleges forcible land acquisition by TMC in WB, holds protest
275.article_body: BJP leaders Sukanta Majumdar, Suvendu Adhikari along with other MLAs carried out a protest rally in West Bengal's Deocha Pachami, against the alleged "forcible land acquisition" by TMC for mining project. "There are small farmers and tribals who are the inhabitants of this place. We are by these poor people and won't allow eviction," State BJP President Sukanta Majumdar said.

276.title: Inflation impacted rich more than poor in FY22: Finance Ministry
276.article_body: Evidence on consumption patterns suggests that inflation in India has impacted the low-income strata lesser than the high-income groups, Finance Ministry wrote in its economic review report for April. It stated that in FY22, inflation for the bottom 20% of urban consumers fell to 5.7% from 6.8%. Meanwhile, inflation for the top 20% fell to 5.7% from 6.5%, it added.

277.title: CSK out of IPL 2022 playoffs race as MI record their 3rd win
277.article_body: Bottom-placed MI defeated ninth-placed CSK by five wickets to register their third victory in IPL 2022. With the defeat, CSK are now officially out of contention for a place in the playoffs. The match witnessed CSK getting dismissed for 97, their second-lowest total in IPL. MI pacer Daniel Sams took three wickets, while Tilak Varma top-scored for MI with 34*(32).

278.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Ellen to testify as Amber's witness in trial: Report
278.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend Ellen Barkin will reportedly be testifying in Amber Heard's defence in the defamation trial against the actress. Ellen, who dated Depp in the late 1990s, reportedly testified at Depp's libel case in the UK that he threw a wine bottle in her direction during an argument. Depp denied her claims, saying she held a "grudge" against him.

279.title: We have devised strategy to beat BJP in BMC polls: Maha Congress
279.article_body: The Maharashtra Congress said that it has "devised a strategy" to defeat the rival BJP in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections. "The BJP will not get more than 30 corporators in the BMC elections," Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Atul Londhe said.  When asked about an alliance with the Shiv Sena, Londhe said, "There is little chance of an alliance."

280.title: Man shot dead in Bihar for honking and asking for passage for car
280.article_body: A man was shot dead in Bihar's Aurangabad late on Wednesday night for honking while asking for a passage for his car, police said. The victim, Sanjit Kumar Singh, was returning from his brother-in-law's pre-wedding ceremony when he honked to ask the accused, Santosh Kumar Singh, to give way for his car. Santosh then shot Sanjit in his head.

281.title: Targeted killings continue in J&K: Ex-CM on Kashmiri Pandit's killing
281.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and NC leader Omar Abdullah condemned the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam and said, "Targeted killings continue and a sense of fear grows unchecked." He also extended condolences to Bhat's family. Rahul Bhat was a government official, who was shot at by terrorists in his office.

282.title: Denmark to charge ex-defence minister for leaking state secrets
282.article_body: Denmark's public prosecutor is set to formally charge former Defence Minister Claus Hjort Frederiksen who has been accused of leaking state secrets, the country's justice ministry said. Frederiksen served as Denmark's defence minister from 2016 to 2019 and is currently under parliamentary immunity as he's a lawmaker. He could face up to 12 years in jail if convicted on charges.

283.title: Palestinian Prez blames Israel for the killing of Al Jazeera journalist
283.article_body:
Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has said that Israeli authorities were "fully responsible" for the killing of Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh. He said that 
Palestinian National Authority "will go to the International Criminal Court to track down the criminals". The 51-year-old journalist was reportedly "shot in the face" while she was covering an Israeli military raid in West Bank.

284.title: 2 pilots dead after helicopter crashes at Raipur airport
284.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said that two pilots, Captain Panda and Captain Srivastava, died after a state helicopter crashed at an airport in Raipur. "May God give strength to his family members and peace to the departed soul in this time of grief," he added. The accident reportedly took place when they were trying to land the helicopter.

285.title: Over 6 million people have fled Ukraine since Russian invasion: UN
285.article_body: At least six million have fled Ukraine since Russia began its military offensive there, a UN refugee agency confirmed on Thursday. Most refugees have crossed over to the European Union through border points in Poland, Slovakia and Hungary among other countries. Over eight million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine, according to International Organization for Migration (IOM) report.

286.title: Kolkata Traffic Police mandated to carry firearms on night duty
286.article_body: The Kolkata Police Headquarters issued a notification directing traffic police personnel to mandatorily carry firearms on night duty. "Firearms and ammunition must be collected from the local police station before joining night duty. When the duty is over, firearms have to be deposited there," it stated. Traffic policemen face several issues during naka checking when unarmed, police said.

287.title: Dacoity attempt foiled in Maharashtra's Thane; 4 arrested
287.article_body:
Officials said that police foiled a dacoity attempt and arrested four persons in Maharashtra's Thane.
They said that they arrested the accused near a liquor bar and recovered three country-made revolvers, eight bullets and a motorcycle from them. Interrogation revealed that the accused were planning to rob farmhouses in Thane city and Karjat, they added.

288.title: Not attempting to be Tiger: Arjun on his physical transformation
288.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, talking about his 15-month physical transformation, said he's not Tiger Shroff and isn't attempting to be like him. "I want to be the best version of Arjun that has been loved by audiences," he added. Arjun said his body has changed since his Bollywood debut which is why it took him 15 months to get in shape.

289.title: Bollywood definitely can't afford Mahesh Babu, he is correct: Kangana
289.article_body: Reacting to Telugu actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, actress Kangana Ranaut has said, "He is absolutely correct." Kangana added she knows that Mahesh gets many offers from various filmmakers. "His generation of actors has made the Telugu film industry the number one film industry in India. So, Bollywood definitely cannot afford him," she concluded.

290.title: Tesla to face its 1st jury trial in US over fatal Model S crash
290.article_body: Tesla is set to face its first jury trial over a car crash after a US court rejected its request to dismiss a case without trial. In 2018, 18-year-old Barrett Riley, who was driving a Tesla Model S, died after his car engulfed into flames after hitting a wall at 116 miles/hour. The lawsuit alleges the car's battery was defective.

291.title: Katrina not pregnant, reports of her pregnancy untrue: Actress' team
291.article_body: The respective representatives of actors Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have denied the reports that claimed that the actress is two months pregnant. Katrina's team categorically denied the rumours of the actress' pregnancy, adding that they are untrue. Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif tied the knot on December 9, 2021, at The Six Senses Fort Barwara in Rajasthan.

292.title: Yamuna level low, water supply likely to be hit in Delhi on Friday
292.article_body: Water supply is likely to be affected in parts of Delhi on May 13 on account of the water level depleting in the Yamuna river, according to the Delhi Jal Board. The water supply is likely to be hit in parts of Kamla Nagar, Model Town, Civil Lines, Karol Bagh, Greater Kailash, Moolchand, Burari, Tughlakabad, Kalkaji, Jahangirpuri and more.

293.title: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah arrested for protesting against anti-encroachment drive
293.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested by Delhi Police on Thursday after he took part in a protest against South Delhi Municipal Corporation's anti-encroachment drive at Madanpur Khadar. He was detained by the police in the morning. Police had said that protesters pelted stones at security personnel, leaving a few injured.

294.title: We have to take 'retaliatory steps' if Finland joins NATO: Russia
294.article_body: Russia on Thursday warned Finland against joining NATO and threatened it with "retaliatory steps, both of a military-technical and other nature". Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Finland's move to join NATO was "definitely" a threat to Russia, adding, "NATO expansion doesn't make our continent more...secure." This comes after Finland said the country should apply to join NATO "without delay".

295.title: Pics show crowd as Rahul takes train to Udaipur; coolie gives him flowers
295.article_body: Congress has shared pictures showing crowded platform as Rahul Gandhi boarded train to Rajasthan's Udaipur to take part in the three-day Chintan Shivir. A video has also been shared, which showed the leader meeting a delegation of the coolie association, with one of them handing flowers. Congress earlier said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during 'Chintan Shivir'.

296.title: Delhi logs 1,032 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, active cases at 4,928
296.article_body: Delhi on Thursday recorded 1,032 fresh COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, while the active cases in the city stand at 4,928, according to data shared by the state health department. The national capital's overall covid tally has increased to 18,98,173 while the death count stood at 26,184. Delhi reported 970 fresh COVID-19 cases and one death on Wednesday.

297.title: PM's wrong economic policies led to current financial crisis: Pawar
297.article_body: NCP leader Sharad Pawar on Thursday said it was PM Narendra Modi's "wrong economic policies that led to the current financial crisis". "Decisions such as demonetisation made without people’s participation are mainly responsible for it," he added. However, he said there was no fear of India facing a similar situation to that of Sri Lanka.

298.title: Will fulfil challenge of uplifting Sri Lanka's economy: PM Wickremesinghe
298.article_body: Newly-appointed Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Thursday that he's taken up the challenge of uplifting the country's economy amid ongoing crisis and will ensure that he fulfils it. He added that anti-government protesters "should stay" and engage with the administration. Wickremesinghe's appointment came days after ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned amid clashes that claimed eight lives.

299.title: Israel approves construction of over 4,000 homes in West Bank: Report
299.article_body: Israel on Thursday approved the construction of 4,427 new homes in its settlements on the West Bank, a watchdog group said. The move comes days after Israel's Interior Minister Ayelet Shaked announced the plan to build these houses. "Israel's program of expanding settlements deeply damages the prospect for a two-state solution [with Palestine]," the US State Department said.

300.title: Punjab teachers fight over free lunch after meeting CM, video surfaces
300.article_body: A video has surfaced showing school teachers in Punjab pushing each other to get a plate of free lunch after a meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann. He had called the meeting with school teachers and principals to discuss reforms in education. The government had arranged lunch for the teachers at the venue.

301.title: Will never have guts to have baby out of wedlock: Masaba Gupta
301.article_body: Masaba Gupta said despite being a modern woman she'll never have the "guts" to have a baby out of wedlock. "I don't want to take that extra pressure and put a child in that space," she stated. Masaba, who is the daughter of Neena Gupta and Viv Richards, added, "I've been tagged too modern for being born out of wedlock."

302.title: Chennai Super Kings record their second-lowest total in IPL
302.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on Thursday were dismissed for 97 runs in 16 overs against Mumbai Indians (MI). It is their second-lowest total in IPL. This is the second time in IPL that CSK were bowled out for less than 100 runs. CSK's lowest IPL total had come on May 5, 2013, when they were dismissed for 79 against MI.

303.title: 'Very big opposition leader told me becoming PM twice is enough,' reveals PM Modi
303.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday revealed that a "very big" opposition leader met him one day and said that becoming Prime Minister of the country twice was enough. "He doesn't know that Modi is made of a different mettle...That's why I don't believe in taking it easy...My dream is saturation, 100% coverage of the welfare schemes," PM Modi said.

304.title: Those behind Kashmiri Pandit's killing won't go unpunished: J&K Lt Guv
304.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Thursday condemned the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit after he was shot dead by militants in the valley. "I strongly condemn the barbaric killing of Rahul Bhat by terrorists at Budgam. Those behind this despicable terror attack will not go unpunished," he said. The government stands with the bereaved family, he added.

305.title: Which states/UTs have the highest percentage of wealthy households in India?
305.article_body: In the recently released data of the National Family Health Survey 5 (NFHS) report, Chandigarh (79%) is stated to have the largest number of wealthy households in India based on the percentage distribution of its residents. This is followed by Delhi (68%) and Punjab (61%). Haryana, Puducherry and Kerala have over 40% of their population in the highest wealth quintile.

306.title: There will never be a 'Congress-mukt' India: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
306.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said there will never be "a Congress-mukt Bharat" and that those wishing so will themselves be decimated. People look at Congress as the main opposition and through the Chintan Shivir, a new message will be sent across the country, Gehlot further said. India has been run on the principles of Congress, he added.

307.title: Pic of Shah Rukh Khan, Rajkumar Hirani from 'Dunki' sets goes viral
307.article_body: A picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani from the sets of 'Dunki' has gone viral on social media. In the picture, Shah Rukh can be seen wearing a grey t-shirt and dark jeans, along with sunglasses. Commenting on the pic, a Twitter user wrote, "He's looking so fresh, same as 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' Shahrukh."

308.title: West's arms supplies to Ukraine may trigger conflict with NATO: Russia
308.article_body: The Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, on Thursday warned that the increasing military support given to Ukraine by the West may trigger a conflict between Russia and the NATO military alliance. He said, "Such a conflict always has the risk of turning into a full-fledged nuclear war." "This will be a disastrous scenario for everyone," he added.

309.title: Ashni Biyani resigns as Future Consumer MD due to 'personal constraints'
309.article_body: Ashni Biyani, daughter of Future Group CEO Kishore Biyani, has resigned as the MD of Future Consumer Limited citing "personal constraints and challenges", the company said in a stock exchange filing on Thursday. "She has also ceased to be a 'key managerial personnel' of the company," the company further said. She will continue to serve as Future Consumer's Non-Executive Director.

310.title: WHO must be reformed & strengthened: PM Modi at Global COVID Summit
310.article_body: While speaking at the second US-hosted virtual global summit on COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi said the World Health Organization (WHO) must be reformed and strengthened to build a more resilient health security architecture. "India is ready to play a key role in this effort," he added. PM Modi said India adopted a people-centric strategy against the pandemic.

311.title: We use traditional medicines in India to boost immunity: PM at COVID summit
311.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at second US-hosted global virtual summit on COVID-19 said, "In India, we extensively use our traditional medicines to supplement our fight against COVID-19 and...boost immunity." He added that last month, India laid the foundation of the WHO centre of traditional medicine in the country with an aim to make this knowledge available to the world.

312.title: Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Dobaaraa' to release on August 19
312.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu's film 'Dobaaraa' will release on August 19 in theatres. The film, which is directed by Anurag Kashyap, was announced in 2021. Actor Pavail Gulati, who shared the screen with Taapsee in Anubhav Sinha's 'Thappad', also features in the film. This is Anurag and Taapsee's third collaboration after 'Manmarziyaan' and 'Saand Ki Aankh'.

313.title: Centre not releasing MGNREGA, PMAY funds to WB: CM Mamata
313.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, stating that the central government isn't releasing funds to Bengal for MGNREGA and PM Awas Yojana. "In Awas Yojana, West Bengal is Number 1 in the country and from 2016-17, more than 32 lakh houses had been constructed in the state," Banerjee wrote.

314.title: Centre aims to build 18,000 km of highways in FY23: Nitin Gadkari
314.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Thursday that Centre aims to build 18,000 km of highways in financial year 2022-23 at a speed of 50 km/day. He added that the government's overall target is to develop 2 lakh km of National Highway Network by 2025. The pace of national highway (NH) construction in India had touched 37 km/day in 2020-21.

315.title: 10-yr-old YouTuber demands ₹3-crore as ransom from doctor, arrested with father in UP
315.article_body: After a caller allegedly threatened to kidnap an Uttarakhand doctor's son and demanded ₹3 crore as ransom, police said they found the caller to be a 10-year-old YouTuber in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. The police have arrested the boy and his father after putting their phone on electronic surveillance. A police team was also reportedly deployed outside the doctor's hospital.

316.title: Delhivery IPO subscribed 23% on Day 2, retail portion booked 40%
316.article_body: Delhivery's IPO, worth ₹5,235 crore, was subscribed to 23% by the end of Day 2 on Thursday, a 2% above its Day 1 subscription tally. The retail portion saw the highest subscription at 40%, followed by the qualified institutional investors portion at 29%. Meanwhile, the non-institutional buyers portion remained unchanged at 1% subscription.

317.title: Sanctions on Russia won't affect global oil supply: IEA
317.article_body: The International Energy Agency (IEA) said the world won't be left short of oil even with lower output from sanctions-hit Russia. "Steadily rising volumes from...OPEC+ and the US along with a slowdown in demand growth is expected to fend off an acute supply deficit," the IEA said. This comes after it predicted a possible global oil "supply shock" in March.

318.title: CSK's Conway gets out on golden duck as DRS not available due to power issues
318.article_body: CSK opener Devon Conway was dismissed for a golden duck after the on-field umpire adjudged him LBW out off MI's Daniel Sams. Conway couldn't take a review as the facility wasn't available due to power issues in the stadium. After watching the replay, commentator Simon Doull was heard saying, "Oh dear me. It's missing leg [stump] by a long way."

319.title: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
319.article_body: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.

320.title: Ather Energy raises $128 mn led by state-owned NIIFL, Hero MotoCorp
320.article_body: Ather Energy has raised $128 million in its Series E round of funding, the electric two-wheeler maker said on Thursday. The round was led by India's sovereign wealth fund National Investment and Infrastructure Fund Limited's (NIIFL) Strategic Opportunities Fund (SOF) and Hero MotoCorp, among others. With this investment, the Bengaluru-based company has raised over $230 million financing to date.

321.title: N Korea fires 3 suspected ballistic missiles, 16th weapons test in 2022
321.article_body: North Korea on Thursday fired three suspected short-range ballistic missiles toward the sea off its east coast, the South Korean military said. This is said to be the country's 16th known weapons test this year. The launch came hours after North Korea confirmed its first-ever COVID-19 infection and declared a "serious emergency", with leader Kim Jong-un ordering a national lockdown.

322.title: Cong has capability, leadership to reform from within: Hooda
322.article_body: Senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday asserted that the party has the capability and the leadership to reform itself from within. On whether demands such as setting up a parliamentary board would be discussed, he said, "Election process is going on, it will be completed in a few months, other things will be looked upon after the election."

323.title: Appeasement politics ends with 100% coverage of govt schemes: PM Modi
323.article_body: Politics of appeasement comes to an end with 100% coverage of government schemes, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Thursday. He was addressing 'Utkarsh Samaroh' in Gujarat, via video conferencing and said, "Due to lack of information about government schemes, they either remain on paper or people not entitled for such schemes take benefit."

324.title: First pic of supermassive black hole at the centre of Milky Way released
324.article_body: Astronomers have unveiled the first image of the supermassive black hole at the centre of the Milky Way galaxy. "The new view captures light bent by the powerful gravity of the black hole, which is four million times more massive than our Sun," astronomers said. The image was produced by a global research team called the Event Horizon Telescope Collaboration.

325.title: Investors lose nearly ₹19 lakh crore in five trading sessions
325.article_body: The wealth of equity investors tumbled by over ₹18.74 lakh crore as the market indices continued to fall for the fifth session on Thursday. While the Sensex plunged 1,158 points to end at 52,930 on Thursday, the Nifty plunged 359 points to settle at 15,808. Markets continued to remain under pressure in sync with the global markets slump, experts said.

326.title: Largest white diamond ever auctioned, larger than a golf ball, sold for $21.9 mn
326.article_body: 'The Rock', the biggest white diamond ever auctioned, was sold for 21,681,000 Swiss francs ($21.9 million) by auction house Christie's in Geneva. The pear-cut diamond of 228.31 carats, larger than a golf ball, was sold by an unnamed owner from North America and was bought by a private collector bidding by telephone. The pre-sale estimate was 19-30 million Swiss francs.

327.title: Meta tells hardware staffers to prepare for cutbacks: Report
327.article_body: Meta is preparing cutbacks in its Reality Labs division, a unit which is part of the company's strategy to refocus on hardware products and the metaverse, Reuters reported citing a spokesperson. Meta Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth on Tuesday said the changes are expected within a week. Meta isn't planning layoffs as part of the changes, the spokesperson added.

328.title: MI to bowl first against CSK in bottom-of-the-table clash, Kieron Pollard dropped
328.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in the bottom-of-the-table clash in IPL 2022. Bottom-placed MI have dropped Kieron Pollard from their playing XI and have replaced him with Tristan Stubbs. They have also included Hrithik Shokeen in place of Murugan Ashwin. Meanwhile, ninth-placed CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

329.title: It does disappoint: Kiara Advani on role of actresses in comedy films
329.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, speaking about comedy films, has said, "It's very rare that a female protagonist adds a punch." She added that the character arc of a male protagonist and a female protagonist cannot be compared. "Unfortunately that's how (the script) is written...It definitely does disappoint," Kiara further said. The actress will next be seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

330.title: DS Chauhan given additional charge of UP DGP after Mukul Goel's removal
330.article_body: IPS officer and DG Intelligence DS Chauhan has been given the additional charge of Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP), a day after Mukul Goel was removed from the post for reportedly neglecting his work. Goel has been made the Director General (DG) of the Civil Defence department, as per an official statement. Goel is a 1987-batch IPS officer.

331.title: Got colonial characters in India due to white face: 'RRR' actor Edward
331.article_body: American actor Edward Sonnenblick, who featured in 'RRR', has said, "There was...niche for someone like me in the industry, white faces got colonial characters. That's the majority of roles that come my way." However, he added he does get to play other roles in films like 'Saving Chintu' where he played an American guy trying to adopt a kid.

332.title: Make Tamil official language of Madras HC: TN CM Stalin to PM Modi
332.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Chief Justice NV Ramana on Thursday urging them to fulfil three demands, including making Tamil the official language of Madras HC. Stalin in his letter added that there should be diversity in appointment of judges. Thirdly, he cited the need for setting up permanent regional benches of SC.

333.title: Rishabh Pant has made simple mistakes with his shot selection: Watson
333.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said the team's captain Rishabh Pant has made "simple" mistakes with his shot selection in IPL 2022 so far. "Little things haven't gone Pant's way. A couple of random chop ons out of nowhere," added Watson. "Pant's mindset is to entertain. He would prefer to go down taking the game on than...being defensive," stated Watson.

334.title: Congress stages protest against inflation & unemployment in Bhopal
334.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Youth Congress staged a protest against the BJP government in Madhya Pradesh regarding issues like inflation, corruption and unemployment in Bhopal. Congress State President Kamal Nath was also present during the protest and the protesters marched towards CM's residence, raising slogans against the government. The police used water cannons on the protesting Congress workers.

335.title: Attempt to get publicity: Pawar on Patole's 'backstabber' remark
335.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole's "backstabber" comment and said that it was an "attempt to get publicity". He said, "We know from which party he has come. Does that mean he has stabbed someone?" Earlier, Patole called NCP a backstabber after they joined hands with BJP during Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

336.title: Muslims being harassed in BJP regime: BSP Supremo Mayawati
336.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) Supremo Mayawati criticised the Yogi Adityanath-led BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and claimed that Muslims were being harassed in BJP-ruled states. In a series of tweets, Mayawati accused the Uttar Pradesh government of harassing political opponents. She also condemned the government for keeping SP leader Azam Khan in jail for about two-and-a-half years.

337.title: Ukraine to put first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes: Report
337.article_body: Amid Russia's ongoing invasion, Ukraine to put the first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes, DW quoted Ukraine's top prosecutor Iryna Venediktova as saying. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian soldier, will reportedly face the trial for killing an unarmed 62-year-old man in Ukraine. Shishimarin could face fifteen years imprisonment on charges of war crimes and premeditated murder.

338.title: India's industrial output rises from 1.5% in Feb to 1.9% in Mar
338.article_body: India's industrial output, measured in terms of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 1.9% in March, up from 1.5% in February. This comes after data released on April 29 showed output of India's eight core sectors grew 4.3% YoY in March 2022, down from 6% in February 2022. The eight sectors account for 40.3% of IIP.

339.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe takes oath as new PM of crisis-hit Sri Lanka
339.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, an opposition lawmaker, has been sworn in as the new Prime Minister of Sri Lanka by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa amid political and economic crisis in the country. This comes days after former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa quit his post and went to an undisclosed location with his family amid protests in the island nation.

340.title: SRK-led Knight Riders Group acquires Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League
340.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan-led Knight Riders Group has acquired the Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League.  "We're excited about becoming part of UAE’s T20 League, which no doubt will become hugely successful," Shah Rukh said. As many as six teams will compete in UAE's T20 League. Reliance Industries Limited also owns a team in the league.

341.title: India needs a stronger Oppn: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
341.article_body: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar said that India needs a "stronger Opposition" and called the current Opposition "weak". He said, "Lack of leadership in the Opposition can make any democracy appear not as a democracy." He added, "West Bengal has shown that with free-and-fair elections, no party can meddle with the institutions of India."

342.title: Indian Army to buy 12 Swathi weapon-locating radars for China border
342.article_body: The Indian Army has put up a proposal to the Defence Ministry for buying 12 'Swathi' weapon-locating radars developed by DRDO. Swathi weapon-locating radars provide fast, automatic and accurate location of enemy weapons like mortars, shells and rockets within 50-kilometre range. The Army has been using the radars for its operations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir.

343.title: Need action against those who filed sedition cases due to pressure: BJP MP
343.article_body: BJP MP from Mumbai North, Gopal Shetty, said on Wednesday that strong action must be taken against those officials who have filed sedition cases against individuals "under pressure". Shetty's comments come as SC has permitted the Centre to re-examine the provisions of Section 124A of IPC that criminalises sedition. Over 300 sedition cases have been filed since 2014.

344.title: Biden administration has taken Quad to leader level: White House
344.article_body: White House on Wednesday said that the US President Joe Biden-led US administration has taken the Quad to the leader level. "We are the first administration that has taken the Quad- that is the United States, Australia, India, and Japan- to the leader level," a senior administration official said. His remarks came on the eve of the US-ASEAN Special Summit.

345.title: Mumbai is at flood risk again: AAP as it criticises BMC
345.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party accused the Mumbai civic body BMC of shoddy pre-monsoon work and said Mumbai is at flood risk again. AAP demanded an external independent body to be appointed to audit the pre-monsoon preparation of BMC. "The Shiv Sena government has shown complete apathy to death and devastation caused in Mumbai year after year," AAP Mumbai president said.

346.title: BJP-led Centre may amend sedition law instead of revoking it: Moitra
346.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Thursday said the BJP-led Centre is "not keen on revoking the draconian legislation (sedition law)" and may instead amend it. This comes a day after the Supreme Court put the sedition law on hold. "Had the Centre been serious in reconsidering the law, it could have done it in the last eight years," she added.

347.title: Can't do 'Koffee With Karan' but can do 'Tea with Twinkle', jokes Twinkle
347.article_body: Actress-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna took to Instagram and shared a photo of herself with a cup and rollers on her hair. "Can't do 'Koffee with Karan' again but 'Tea with Twinkle' may not be a bad idea after all," she captioned her post. Twinkle appeared on the show, hosted by Karan Johar, with her husband Akshay Kumar in season five.

348.title: Another internet shutdown in Raj after attack on VHP leader
348.article_body: Mobile internet services were suspended and communal tension gripped Rajasthan's Nohar town after VHP leader Satveer Saharan was attacked by some people, officials said on Thursday.
