Saharan was attacked on Wednesday evening when he, along with others, objected to a group of people sitting on a vacant plot next to a temple and creating a nuisance.

349.title: UP govt makes singing national anthem mandatory in all state madrasas
349.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has made it mandatory for students and teachers to sing the national anthem before starting classes in all madrasas of the state. The order has been implemented from May 12 (Thursday). UP Cabinet Minister Danish Azad said, "When the national anthem is sung, students would learn society's values."

350.title: Garbage collectors return bag with jewellery & cash in Navi Mumbai
350.article_body: Two garbage collectors returned a bag with gold jewellery, cash and a mobile phone to its owners after they found it during garbage collection in Navi Mumbai's Uran. The owner of the bag, Sushali Dhananjay Nakhwa, a fish seller, lost it while he was going to hospital. The garbage collectors found the bag, approached the police and returned it.

351.title: Can't get married as rumours are spread that I beat up boys: Kangana
351.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in an interview with RJ Siddharth Kannan, was asked if she is like her character in 'Dhaakad' in real life. To this, she replied, "Who will I beat up in real life? I'm unable to get married because of people like you spreading these rumours." "Rumours are spread about me that I beat up boys," she added.

352.title: Korean in Gurugram hits cook with pressure cooker for missing train
352.article_body: A Korean resident of Gurugram allegedly beat his Nepali cook for missing the train to his home, police said on Wednesday. The complainant said that he took leave from May 10 to go to his country, but missed his train. His employer beat him with a pressure cooker lid when he went back, the complainant said, according to the police.

353.title: Mumbai to get a single planning authority: Aaditya Thackeray
353.article_body: Deliberations are being held to set up a single planning authority headed by an "empowered" mayor for Mumbai, Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray said on Thursday. Project implementation will remain with existing agencies such as Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority. "To repair one footpath...there are 42 utilities and coordination is required for each one," Thackeray said.

354.title: Biker falls on road as car driver abruptly opens door in Hyd; video surfaces
354.article_body: A man riding a bike fell on the road after the driver of a parked car abruptly opened the door in Hyderabad. The Cyberabad Traffic Police has shared a video of the incident that shows people running to help the man on the bike. "Always use your furthest hand to open the door," the police said.

355.title: India's retail inflation surges to 7.79% in April, highest in 8 years
355.article_body: India's retail inflation surged to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014, data released by the government on Thursday showed. At 7.79%, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation for April is higher than the March number of 6.95%. Earlier this month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das had said inflation was "expected to be elevated" in April.

356.title: You don't work for it: Arjun on being generation's 1st actor to cross ₹100-cr mark
356.article_body: On being asked about being first actor from his generation to have crossed ₹100-crore mark, actor Arjun Kapoor said, "Yes I was the first (actor of my generation) to cross the ₹100-crore mark but that's not something you work for. You work for making films that continuously do well. The numbers evolve. Phases happen in an actor's life."

357.title: ED raids premises of former Odisha MLA, seizes FDs worth over ₹133 crore
357.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has carried out raids at various premises linked to former Odisha MLA Jitendra Nath Patnaik in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining. "A seizure of cash amounting to ₹70 lakh and 124 fixed deposits amounting to ₹133.17 crore has been made," the ED said. Patnaik is a former independent MLA from the Champua Assembly constituency.

358.title: Thane Police allegedly extort ₹6 crore from toy trader, 10 officers suspended
358.article_body: Ten policemen who were attached with Mumbra police station under Thane City Police Commissionerate have been suspended after they allegedly extorted ₹6 crore from toy trader and builder, Faisal Memon, last month. Reports said police claimed they had tip-off about unaccounted cash with Memon. A complainant, Shaikh Ibrahim, said police forcibly took ₹6 crore from Memon to suppress the case.

359.title: Woman receives head injuries in leopard attack, 4th incident in 3 days
359.article_body: A 45-year-old woman received severe head injuries after being attacked by a leopard in Pune's Khed taluka on Thursday. This is the fourth such attack in the last three days. Three people, including two women, were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attack in Khed and Ambegaon talukas on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning.

360.title: Over $200 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours
360.article_body: More than $200 billion of wealth was wiped out from the cryptocurrency market in just 24 hours amid a massive sell-off, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing CoinMarketCap data. The crypto plunge was driven by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. The plunge affected major tokens and Bitcoin plunged by as much as 10% to its lowest level since December 2020.

361.title: Kashmiri Pandit shot dead by terrorists in J&K
361.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit, identified as Rahul Bhat, was shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Budgam district in what is said to be an instance of a targeted attack. "Terrorists fired upon one employee namely Shri Rahul Bhat from minority community in Tehsildar office, Chadoora," Kashmir Police said. He was hospitalised after the attack but succumbed to his injuries.

362.title: Pune boy who was locked with 20 dogs needs mental health evaluation: Experts
362.article_body: After the parents of an 11-year-old boy allegedly confined him to his house in Pune with more than 20 dogs, experts say that the boy and his parents need extensive mental health evaluation. "Helping the child get back into the mainstream is vital," a child and adolescent psychiatrist said. The boy has been rescued and sent to a shelter home.

363.title: Finland joining NATO is definite threat to us: Russia
363.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said Finland's move to join NATO was "definitely" a threat to Russia and threatened an unspecified response. The expansion of the US-led military alliance "does not make our continent [Europe] more stable and secure", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Finland, which shares a 1,300-kilometre  border with Russia, has joined "unfriendly steps" against Russia, he added.

364.title: I'm mortified, have a lot of anxiety; won't watch 'Doctor Strange..': Elizabeth
364.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, when asked about being leading lady in a blockbuster movie, said that she is mortified and has a lot of anxiety about 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. She added she will not be watching the movie and that she is facing such pressure for the first time. "I've never...had to lead...commercial film...by myself," she added.

365.title: BJP is diverting people's attention from real issues: Sachin Pilot
365.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday accused the BJP of diverting people's attention from the real issues. He said, "There is chaos in the fiscal management and the economic policies of the government have been a monumental failure and there is no accountability in the government." His remarks came before the party's "Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir" in Udaipur.

366.title: 26,650 Russian soldiers killed, 1,195 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
366.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that about 26,650 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine forces have destroyed 1,195 Russian tanks and 360 aircraft, including 161 helicopters, the ministry added. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 2,873 armoured personnel carriers, 534 artillery systems and 191 multiple launch rocket systems.

367.title: SUGAR Cosmetics looks to double revenue, expand to 60,000 stores
367.article_body: D2C beauty brand SUGAR Cosmetics is targeting to double its gross revenues to ₹600 crore in FY23 and achieve net revenue of over ₹500 crore, CEO Vineeta Singh said. The Shark Tank India judge added that the brand's looking to expand its offline presence to over 60,000 stores in the next 12-15 months. Currently, it's available in about 30,000 outlets.

368.title: NDRF conducts field trials of unmanned vehicles, gadgets in Pune
368.article_body: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) conducted field trials of unmanned aerial and marine vehicles and other modern gadgets on May 10 and 11 at headquarters of 5th Battalion at Sudumbare in Pune. As many as 10 firms showcased their equipment that can be used in disaster relief operations. The exhibited technologies included drone-based aerial mapping and advanced image analytics.

369.title: I want to steal Djokovic's elasticity, Nadal's self-sacrifice: Alcaraz
369.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he wants to steal Novak Djokovic's elasticity and physique as well as Roger Federer's elegance. "I would steal Rafael Nadal's fighting spirit, self-sacrifice, work ethic. If I have to train three hours, I train at 200 percent intensity," added Alcaraz. "I want to continue climbing...If it can be to heaven, even better," stated Alcaraz.

370.title: Don't pick up call & ask 'Should I work on particular project': Nazia on Sanjay
370.article_body: Actress Nazia Hussain, who is the grand daughter of actor Sanjay Dutt's maternal uncle, said that she does not pick up the call and ask the actor if she should be taking up particular projects. "When you are related to someone who's such a big star, it's constantly like 'Am I going to be good enough'," she added.

371.title: US' Arizona carries out 1st execution in 8 years
371.article_body: US' Arizona on Wednesday carried out its first execution since 2014, putting to death a prisoner convicted of killing a 21-year-old student 44 years ago. Clarence Dixon, convicted of stabbing and strangling of Arizona State University student Deana Bowdoin in 1978, was executed by lethal injection. Dixon is the sixth person to be executed in US this year.

372.title: Muslim cleric insults Class 10 girl on stage in Kerala; Guv criticises him
372.article_body: A Muslim cleric allegedly scolded organisers of an event for inviting a Class 10 girl student on stage to receive an award in Kerala's Malappuram district. Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has criticised the cleric for humiliating the girl student. The Governor said, "I am so deeply disappointed that the whole political leadership is silent about it."

373.title: AAP MLA detained for protesting anti-encroachment drive in south Delhi
373.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan and his supporters, who were protesting against an anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area, were detained on Thursday. "I am ready to go to jail if it saves the houses of poor people. There is no encroachment here. I will support them in demolition if there is any encroachment," said Amanatullah.

374.title: Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?: HC on PIL seeking to open Taj Mahal rooms
374.article_body: While rejecting a petition seeking to open 22 closed doors in Taj Mahal, Allahabad High Court asked the petitioner, "Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?" The court said, "Please don't take us to the historical facts which you believe." It added that such debates are for drawing rooms, not for a court of law.

375.title: Man gets fake wife to donate kidney in Pune; she reveals identity on not getting ₹15 lakh
375.article_body: Fifteen people have been booked over an alleged kidney racket after a woman was promised ₹15 lakh to pose as the wife of a man who needed a transplant. She donated her kidney to a young woman and in turn, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man. The woman revealed her real identity after dispute over money.

376.title: Canada to fly in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland
376.article_body: Canada will reportedly bring in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland between late May and early June. The country is going to arrange three flights from Poland's Warsaw to three of its cities - Winnipeg on May 23, Montreal on May 29 and Halifax on June 2. In March, Canada allowed the Ukrainian refugees to stay for three years.

377.title: Cong will have to remain pivot of anti-BJP formation for 2024 polls: Pilot
377.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said Congress is and will have to remain the "pivot" around which an anti-BJP coalition is formed to take on the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "A UPA plus plus formation might be the best one to take on the NDA," Pilot added. "Don't forget NDA has lost many partners since 2019," Pilot stated.

378.title: Cong to introspect strengths, weaknesses during 'Chintan Shivir': Surjewala
378.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during its 'Chintan Shivir'. "Considering...current challenges and situations, our efficiency and skills are not only important to evaluate but bring changes to them as well," he said. Surjewala further stated inflation, unemployment and increasing debt as reasons for holding the session.

379.title: 4 killed, several injured as car overturns after hitting divider in J'khand
379.article_body: Four people died and several others were injured on Thursday after their car hit a road divider and overturned in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district. According to an official, the victims were going to Urmal village after attending a wedding ceremony in Ramgarh area of the district. Three persons were killed on the spot while one died during treatment, the official added.

380.title: 4 killed in suicide blast ahead of presidential vote in Somalia
380.article_body: At least four people were reportedly killed in a suicide blast in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Wednesday. "I saw four people dead at the scene. Two of them were government soldiers who died immediately after the attack," said a police officer. This comes days ahead of the presidential election that is set to take place on Sunday.

381.title: China's engagement with South Pacific countries no threat to Aus: Envoy
381.article_body: China's Ambassador to Australia Xiao Qian has said that the former's engagement with South Pacific countries is conducive to regional stability and isn't a threat to Australia's security. Qian's comments come amid concerns by Australia about a potential Chinese military presence in the Solomon Islands following a bilateral security deal. China and Solomon Islands signed the pact in April.

382.title: Been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of hospital: Urvashi Dholakia
382.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared the reason for her absence on social media and said she was taking care of her ailing mother. Taking to Instagram Story, Urvashi wrote, "[It has] been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of the hospital but now she is back home. The struggle though isn't over as tremendous care has to be taken."

383.title: Director had options but he backed his casting of Alia & me: Arjun on 2 States
383.article_body: As Arjun Kapoor completed 10 years in Bollywood on May 11, he celebrated it by conducting an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram. During the session, one of his fans wrote, "'2 States' is...one of my favourite films." In response, Arjun said, "Our director Abhishek Verman...backed his casting of @aliabhatt and me when he had many options to choose from."

384.title: Hindu Rashtra doesn't mean others can't practice faith: Haryana BJP MLA
384.article_body: BJP MLA from Haryana's Ambala City Aseem Goel said Hindu Rashtra (country) doesn't mean asking people of other religions to stop practicing their faith. "Isn't it justified for a country with 100 crore Hindus to call for a nation for which our ancestors sacrificed their lives for centuries?" Goel said. He had recently pledged to make "Hindustan a Hindu Rashtra".

385.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal shares pic showing her scar after breast cancer surgery
385.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture showing her scar, days after her breast cancer surgery. "I did the unthinkable! I went to the gym today...I could do squats, lunges, Bulgarian split squats, calf raises, single-leg squats and sumo squats," she wrote. "I even got to sport my scar on the armpit while at it," she added.

386.title: I've been raped multiple times because I was too drunk to say 'Stop': Actress Selma Blair
386.article_body: Hollywood actress Selma Blair stated in her memoir that she has been raped multiple times while being drunk. "I was too drunk to say the words 'Please. Stop'," she wrote. "I came out of each event quiet and ashamed," she added. She revealed she was once raped after a day of binge-drinking during a college spring break trip.

387.title: Chhattisgarh Ranji captain Harpreet booked in govt job cheating case
387.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Ranji Trophy team captain Harpreet Singh Bhatia has been booked for cheating and forgery after allegedly getting a government job in the office of Principal Accountant General (Audit) Chhattisgarh by submitting bogus documents. Harpreet had submitted a BCom degree certificate from Bundelkhand University, however, officials found that no such marksheet had been issued.

388.title: Felt that my kiss with Dharmendra was out of the box: Nafisa on Life In A Metro
388.article_body: When asked about the pre-climax scene in film 'Life In A Metro', where Nafisa Ali and Dharmendra share a kiss, the veteran actress replied, "When you are an actor, you have to portray whatever is required from your character. I felt...(the kiss) was out of the box and provided shock value." "Two old people don't...kiss in Hindi movies," she said.

389.title: Once Marsh gets going, he's one of the best T20 batters in the world: Watson
389.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Mitchell Marsh is "one of the best T20 batters in the world" when he gets going. "It took Marsh a few games to get going...after the COVID-19 setback...[but] he adds a lot of value," added Watson. Marsh scored 89(62) to help DC chase down RR's 160-run total. Currently, DC are fifth on IPL standings.

390.title: Karnataka to bring anti-conversion ordinance: CM Bommai
390.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the Cabinet is likely to approve the ordinance move for the anti-conversion bill in its cabinet meeting on Thursday. This comes after the state assembly passed an anti-conversion bill prohibiting conversion from one religion to another by "misrepresentation, force, fraud, allurement or marriage" in December amid Opposition protests.

391.title: 3 UP revenue dept officials among 4 booked for forging land records
391.article_body: Four persons, including three revenue department officials, have been booked for forging land records in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The complainant, who claimed to own a property, alleged that it had been fraudulently registered in the name of another person. An FIR was registered against four people, including a revenue clerk officer and two accountants, police added.

392.title: Russia demands apology from Poland over red paint attack on envoy
392.article_body: Russia has demanded an "official apology" from Poland after Moscow's ambassador to Warsaw was doused with red paint by anti-war protesters. "A decision on further steps will be taken depending on Warsaw's reaction to our demands," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Protesters attacked Sergey Andreev on Monday as he arrived to honour Red Army troops who died during Second World War.

393.title: Ramkrishna, Subramanian's bail pleas in NSE scam case rejected
393.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday dismissed the bail pleas filed by NSE's ex-CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. The CBI told the court that the accused, holding influential positions, could tamper with the evidence and must be kept in custody. Ramkrishna has been accused of frequently revising Subramanian's designation.

394.title: Child sandwiched between parents on scooter motivated me to build Nano: Tata
394.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Tata Nano, the compact car that he launched in 2008. "What really motivated me...was constantly seeing Indian families on scooters, maybe the child sandwiched between the mother and father," Tata wrote on building Nano. "Nano was always meant for all our people," he added.

395.title: Need to create more districts in West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
395.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the state needs to be divided into more districts to accelerate the process of development. "We need to divide the districts as these are very large. The state will have more districts. This will help expedite development work," she said. For this, the state needs more manpower and infrastructure, she added.

396.title: Karnataka cabinet approves anti-conversion bill as ordinance: Home Minister
396.article_body: Karnataka cabinet has approved the anti-conversion bill and it will be discussed in the next Assembly session, the state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. Till then, the ordinance will be in place, he added. "Because the Assembly and Council got prorogued, we're placing a proposal to promulgate an ordinance in the cabinet," CM Basavaraj Bommai had said before the meeting.

397.title: AAP has done nothing: BJP to start campaign to ‘expose’ Delhi govt
397.article_body: BJP's Delhi unit has announced a 'Pol Khol' door-to-door campaign from 15-30 May in the national capital. The party workers will meet over 25 lakh families during the campaign and inform them about AAP government's failures citing 10 key points like unemployment, health, education, etc. "Kejriwal government has done nothing except making tall claims," Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said.

398.title: We are trying for perfect implementation of all govt schemes: Goa CM
398.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Dr Pramod Sawant on Thursday said, "We are trying for a perfect implementation of all govt schemes." He assured that schemes related to housing, sanitation, electricity, social and financial security, equipment for Divyang, Kisan credit among others will be made available to all. "In third tenure of BJP...roads, tourism, medical...development have been taken up," he added.

399.title: 3 killed, 18 injured after vehicle turns upside down in Chhattisgarh
399.article_body: At least three people were killed and 18 were injured after a vehicle turned upside down near Dhodhoi Chowk in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district, police said on Thursday. The accident took place when the driver decided to take the vehicle off-road after spotting a cattle. The vehicle was carrying around 20-25 people who were returning from a wedding ceremony in Panchdewari.

400.title: Salman offers condolences to brother-in-law Aayush on his grandfather's death
400.article_body: Actor Salman Khan offered his condolences to his brother-in-law Aayush Sharma after his grandfather, former politician Pandit Sukh Ram Sharma's death. Sharing a photo of Aayush's grandfather on Instagram, Salman wrote, "Sending my heartfelt condolences to Aayush...on the loss of his grandfather Shri Sukhram ji today." The former Union Minister reportedly suffered a brain stroke.

401.title: Gang members hurl Molotov cocktails at police in TN; 5 arrested
401.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police on Thursday arrested five members of a gang for allegedly hurling Molotov cocktails at the police at an abandoned petroleum refinery in Cuddalore. On Wednesday morning, police visited the refinery after being informed that the gang had engaged in the theft of scrap materials. Seeing the police, the accused hurled Molotov cocktails and fled the spot.
